original: evaṃ saṃnyasya karmāṇi svakāryaparamo 'spṛhaḥ /
analyzed: evam saṃnyasya karmāṇi sva kārya paramaḥ spṛhaḥ
translated: Thus having renounced actions, devoted to one's own duty, without desire,

original: saṃnyāsenāpahatyainaḥ prāpnoti paramaṃ gatim // / //
analyzed: saṃnyāsena apahatya enaḥ prāpnoti paramam gatim
translated: having destroyed sin by renunciation, one attains the highest state.

original: eṣa vo 'bhihito dharmo brāhmaṇasya caturvidhaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vaḥ bhihitaḥ dharmaḥ brāhmaṇasya caturvidhaḥ
translated: Thus the fourfold Dharma of a Brahmin has been declared to you.

original: puṇyo 'kṣayaphalaḥ pretya rājñāṃ dharmaṃ nibodhata // / //
analyzed: puṇyaḥ kṣaya phalaḥ pretya rājñām dharmam nibodhata
translated: It is meritorious, has imperishable fruits in the next world. Now learn the Dharma of kings.

original: rājadharmān pravakṣyāmi yathāvṛtto bhaven nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: rāja dharmān pravakṣyāmi yathāvṛttaḥ bhavet nṛpaḥ
translated: I shall expound the duties of kings, how a king should conduct himself,

original: saṃbhavaś ca yathā tasya siddhiś ca paramā yathā // / //
analyzed: saṃbhavaḥ ca yathā tasya siddhiḥ ca paramā yathā
translated: how he originated, and how he attains the highest success.

original: brāhmaṃ prāptena saṃskāraṃ kṣatriyeṇa yathāvidhi /
analyzed: brāhmam prāptena saṃskāram kṣatriyeṇa yathāvidhi
translated: By a Kshatriya who has attained the consecration according to the rules of the Brahmanas,

original: sarvasyāsya yathānyāyaṃ kartavyaṃ parirakṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: sarvasya asya yathānyāyam kartavyam parirakṣaṇam
translated: The king should protect all this properly.

original: arājake hi loke 'smin sarvato vidruto bhayāt /
analyzed: arājake hi loke smin sarvatas vidrutaḥ bhayāt
translated: In a world without a king, out of fear, everything would scatter in all directions.

original: rakṣārtham asya sarvasya rājānam asṛjat prabhuḥ // / //🔽indrānilayamārkāṇām agneś ca varuṇasya ca /
analyzed: rakṣā artham asya sarvasya rājānam asṛjat prabhuḥ  indra anila yama arkāṇām agneḥ ca varuṇasya ca
translated: The Lord created the king for the protection of all this.🔽Having extracted the eternal parts of Indra, Vayu, Yama, Surya, Agni, Varuna,

original: candravitteśayoś caiva mātrā nirhṛtya śāśvatīḥ // / //
analyzed: candra vitteśayoḥ ca eva mātrāḥ nirhṛtya śāśvatīḥ
translated: Chandra, and Kubera, he created the king.

original: yasmād eṣāṃ surendrāṇāṃ mātrābhyo nirmito nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt eṣām sura indrāṇām mātrābhyaḥ nirmitaḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: Since the king is created from the parts of these lords of the gods,

original: tasmād abhibhavaty eṣa sarvabhūtāni tejasā // / //
analyzed: tasmāt abhibhavati eṣa sarva bhūtāni tejasā
translated: therefore he surpasses all beings with his brilliance.

original: tapaty ādityavac caiṣa cakṣūṃṣi ca manāṃsi ca /
analyzed: tapati āditya vat ca eṣa cakṣūṃṣi ca manāṃsi ca
translated: Like the sun, he scorches the eyes and minds of men.

original: na cainaṃ bhuvi śaknoti kaś cid apy abhivīkṣitum // / //
analyzed: na ca enam bhuvi śaknoti kaḥ cit api abhivīkṣitum
translated: And no one on earth is able to look at him.

original: so 'gnir bhavati vāyuś ca so 'rkaḥ somaḥ sa dharmarāṭ /
analyzed: saḥ gniḥ bhavati vāyuḥ ca saḥ rkaḥ somaḥ sa dharmarāj
translated: He becomes Agni, Vayu, Surya, Soma, and the Lord of Dharma,

original: sa kuberaḥ sa varuṇaḥ sa mahendraḥ prabhāvataḥ // / //
analyzed: sa kuberaḥ sa varuṇaḥ sa mahendraḥ prabhāvataḥ
translated: he is Kubera, Varuna, and the great Indra by his power.

original: bālo 'pi nāvamāntavyo manuṣya iti bhūmipaḥ /
analyzed: bālaḥ na avamāntavyaḥ manuṣyaḥ iti bhūmipaḥ
translated: Even a young king should not be disrespected as a mere man,

original: mahatī devatā hy eṣā nararūpeṇa tiṣṭhati // / //
analyzed: mahatī devatā hi eṣā nara rūpeṇa tiṣṭhati
translated: for he is a great deity standing in human form.

original: ekam eva dahaty agnir naraṃ durupasarpiṇam /
analyzed: ekam eva dahati agniḥ naram durupasarpiṇam
translated: Fire burns only one man who approaches it improperly,

original: kulaṃ dahati rājāgniḥ sapaśudravyasaṃcayam // / //
analyzed: kulam dahati rāja agniḥ sa paśu dravya saṃcayam
translated: The fire of the king burns the family along with its cattle, wealth and accumulation.

original: kāryaṃ so 'vekṣya śaktiṃ ca deśakālau ca tattvataḥ /
analyzed: kāryam saḥ vekṣya śaktim ca deśa kālau ca tattvataḥ
translated: Having considered the matter, his ability, and the place and time accurately,

original: kurute dharmasiddhyarthaṃ viśvarūpaṃ punaḥ punaḥ // / //
analyzed: kurute dharma siddhi artham viśvarūpam punar punar
translated: He repeatedly assumes various forms for the sake of establishing dharma.

original: yasya prasāde padmā śrīr vijayaś ca parākrame /
analyzed: yasya prasāde padmā śrīḥ vijayaḥ ca parākrame
translated: In whose favor there is Lakshmi, in whose valor there is victory,

original: mṛtyuś ca vasati krodhe sarvatejomayo hi saḥ // / //
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ ca vasati krodhe sarva tejaḥ mayaḥ hi saḥ
translated: And death resides in his anger, he is indeed full of all splendor.

original: taṃ yas tu dveṣṭi saṃmohāt sa vinaśyaty asaṃśayam /
analyzed: tam yaḥ tu dveṣṭi saṃmohāt sa vinaśyati asaṃśayam
translated: He who out of delusion hates him, he certainly perishes.

original: tasya hy āśu vināśāya rājā prakurute manaḥ // / //
analyzed: tasya hi āśu vināśāya rājā prakurute manaḥ
translated: For his quick destruction, the king sets his mind.

original: tasmād dharmaṃ yam iṣṭeṣu sa vyavasyen narādhipaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt dharmam yam iṣṭeṣu sa vyavasyet narādhipaḥ
translated: Therefore, the king should determine the dharma that is desired in desirable things,

original: aniṣṭaṃ cāpy aniṣṭeṣu taṃ dharmaṃ na vicālayet // / //
analyzed: aniṣṭam ca api aniṣṭeṣu tam dharmam na vicālayet
translated: And that dharma which is undesirable in undesirable things should not be altered.

original: tasyārthe sarvabhūtānāṃ goptāraṃ dharmam ātmajam /
analyzed: tasya arthe sarva bhūtānām goptāram dharmam ātmajam
translated: For his sake, the lord created the son of dharma, the protector of all beings,

original: brahmatejomayaṃ daṇḍam asṛjat pūrvam īśvaraḥ // / //
analyzed: brahma tejaḥ mayam daṇḍam asṛjat pūrvam īśvaraḥ
translated: The staff full of the splendor of Brahman, in the beginning.

original: tasya sarvāṇi bhūtāni sthāvarāṇi carāṇi ca /
analyzed: tasya sarvāṇi bhūtāni sthāvarāṇi carāṇi ca
translated: Out of fear of him, all beings, the immobile and the mobile,

original: bhayād bhogāya kalpante svadharmān na calanti ca // / //
analyzed: bhayāt bhogāya kalpante svadharmāt na calanti ca
translated: Become fit for enjoyment and do not deviate from their own dharma.

original: taṃ deśakālau śaktiṃ ca vidyāṃ cāvekṣya tattvataḥ /
analyzed: tam deśa kālau śaktim ca vidyām ca avekṣya tattvataḥ
translated: Considering the place, time, ability, and knowledge accurately,

original: yathārhataḥ saṃpraṇayen nareṣv anyāyavartiṣu // / //
analyzed: yathārhataḥ saṃpraṇayet nareṣu anyāya vartiṣu
translated: he should apply punishment as appropriate to men who act unjustly.

original: sa rājā puruṣo daṇḍaḥ sa netā śāsitā ca saḥ /
analyzed: sa rājā puruṣaḥ daṇḍaḥ sa netā śāsitā ca saḥ
translated: That king is the rod of punishment, he is the leader and the ruler.

original: caturṇām āśramāṇāṃ ca dharmasya pratibhūḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: caturṇām āśramāṇām ca dharmasya pratibhūḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: He is remembered as the guarantor of the dharma of the four ashramas.

original: daṇḍaḥ śāsti prajāḥ sarvā daṇḍa evābhirakṣati /
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ śāsti prajāḥ sarvāḥ daṇḍaḥ eva abhirakṣati
translated: Punishment rules over all people, punishment alone protects them.

original: daṇḍaḥ supteṣu jāgarti daṇḍaṃ dharmaṃ vidur budhāḥ // / //
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ supteṣu jāgarti daṇḍam dharmam viduḥ budhāḥ
translated: Punishment is awake while others sleep; the wise know punishment as dharma.

original: samīkṣya sa dhṛtaḥ samyak sarvā rañjayati prajāḥ /
analyzed: samīkṣya sa dhṛtaḥ samyak sarvāḥ rañjayati prajāḥ
translated: When properly applied after careful consideration, it delights all the people.

original: asamīkṣya praṇītas tu vināśayati sarvataḥ // / //
analyzed: a samīkṣya praṇītaḥ tu vināśayati sarvatas
translated: But when applied without consideration, it destroys everything.

original: yadi na praṇayed rājā daṇḍaṃ daṇḍyeṣv atandritaḥ /🔽śūle matsyān ivāpakṣyan durbalān balavattarāḥ // / //
analyzed: yadi na praṇayet rājā daṇḍam daṇḍyeṣu atandritaḥ  śūle matsyān iva apakṣyan durbalān balavattarāḥ
translated: If the king were not to apply punishment to those deserving of it without delay,🔽the strong would devour the weak like fish on a spit.

original: adyāt kākaḥ puroḍāśaṃ śvā ca lihyād dhavis tathā /
analyzed: adyāt kākaḥ puroḍāśam śvā ca lihyāt haviḥ tathā
translated: A crow would eat the sacrificial cake, and a dog would lick the oblation,

original: svāmyaṃ ca na syāt kasmiṃś cit pravartetādharottaram // / //
analyzed: svāmyam ca na syāt kasmin cit pravarteta adharottaram
translated: and there would be no ownership anywhere, and the lower would prevail over the higher.

original: sarvo daṇḍajito loko durlabho hi śucir naraḥ /
analyzed: sarvaḥ daṇḍa jitaḥ lokaḥ durlabhaḥ hi śuciḥ naraḥ
translated: The whole world is conquered by punishment, for a pure man is difficult to find.

original: daṇḍasya hi bhayāt sarvaṃ jagad bhogāya kalpate // / //
analyzed: daṇḍasya hi bhayāt sarvam jagat bhogāya kalpate
translated: For the whole world is fit for enjoyment through fear of punishment.

original: devadānavagandharvā rakṣāṃsi patagoragāḥ /
analyzed: deva dānava gandharvāḥ rakṣāṃsi pataga uragāḥ
translated: Gods, demons, gandharvas, rakshasas, birds, and serpents,

original: te 'pi bhogāya kalpante daṇḍenaiva nipīḍitāḥ // / //🔽duṣyeyuḥ sarvavarṇāś ca bhidyeran sarvasetavaḥ /
analyzed: te pi bhogāya kalpante daṇḍena eva nipīḍitāḥ  duṣyeyuḥ sarva varṇāḥ ca bhidyeran sarva setavaḥ
translated: even they are fit for enjoyment, being oppressed by punishment alone.🔽All the castes would become corrupt, all the boundaries would be broken,

original: sarvalokaprakopaś ca bhaved daṇḍasya vibhramāt // / //
analyzed: sarva loka prakopaḥ ca bhavet daṇḍasya vibhramāt
translated: and all the people would be enraged, if punishment were to fail.

original: yatra śyāmo lohitākṣo daṇḍaś carati pāpahā /
analyzed: yatra śyāmaḥ lohita akṣaḥ daṇḍaḥ carati pāpa hā
translated: Where the dark, red-eyed punishment moves, destroying evil,

original: prajās tatra na muhyanti netā cet sādhu paśyati // / //🔽tasyāhuḥ saṃpraṇetāraṃ rājānaṃ satyavādinam /
analyzed: prajāḥ tatra na muhyanti netā ced sādhu paśyati  tasya āhuḥ saṃpraṇetāram rājānam satya vādinam
translated: the people there are not deluded, if the leader sees rightly.🔽They call the king who speaks the truth,

original: samīkṣyakāriṇaṃ prājñaṃ dharmakāmārthakovidam // / //
analyzed: samīkṣyakāriṇam prājñam dharma kāma artha kovidam
translated: who acts after careful consideration, who is wise, and who knows dharma, kama and artha, the one who sets it in motion.

original: taṃ rājā praṇayan samyak trivargeṇābhivardhate /
analyzed: tam rājā praṇayan samyak trivargeṇa abhivardhate
translated: The king, properly applying him, prospers through the three goals.

original: kāmātmā viṣamaḥ kṣudro daṇḍenaiva nihanyate // / //
analyzed: kāma ātmā viṣamaḥ kṣudraḥ daṇḍena eva nihanyate
translated: One who is lustful, uneven, and petty is destroyed by punishment alone.

original: daṇḍo hi sumahattejo durdharaś cākṛtātmabhiḥ /
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ hi su mahā tejaḥ durdharaḥ ca akṛtātmabhiḥ
translated: For punishment is a very great power, difficult to be borne by those who are not self-controlled.

original: dharmād vicalitaṃ hanti nṛpam eva sabāndhavam // / //
analyzed: dharmāt vicalitam hanti nṛpam eva sa bāndhavam
translated: It destroys the king who deviates from dharma, along with his relatives.

original: tato durgaṃ ca rāṣṭraṃ ca lokaṃ ca sacarācaram /
analyzed: tatas durgam ca rāṣṭram ca lokam ca sacarācaram
translated: Then the fortress, the kingdom, and the world with its moving and unmoving beings,

original: antarikṣagatāṃś caiva munīn devāṃś ca pīḍayet // / //🔽so 'sahāyena mūḍhena lubdhenākṛtabuddhinā /
analyzed: antarikṣa gatān ca eva munīn devān ca pīḍayet  saḥ sahāyena mūḍhena lubdhena akṛtabuddhinā
translated: And also afflict the sages and gods who move in the sky.🔽He cannot be properly led by one who is without allies, foolish, greedy, of undeveloped intellect,

original: na śakyo nyāyato netuṃ saktena viṣayeṣu ca // / //🔽śucinā satyasaṃdhena yathāśāstrānusāriṇā /
analyzed: na śakyaḥ nyāyataḥ netum saktena viṣayeṣu ca  śucinā satya saṃdhena yathā śāstra anusāriṇā
translated: and attached to objects of sense.🔽But the rod of punishment can be wielded by one who is pure, faithful to his promises, follows the scriptures,

original: praṇetuṃ śakyate daṇḍaḥ susahāyena dhīmatā // / //
analyzed: praṇetum śakyate daṇḍaḥ su sahāyena dhīmatā
translated: and is wise and has good allies.

original: svarāṣṭre nyāyavṛttaḥ syād bhṛśadaṇḍaś ca śatruṣu /
analyzed: sva rāṣṭre nyāya vṛttaḥ syāt bhṛśa daṇḍaḥ ca śatruṣu
translated: He should conduct himself justly in his own kingdom, but be severe in punishing enemies.

original: suhṛtsv ajihmaḥ snigdheṣu brāhmaṇeṣu kṣamānvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: suhṛtsu a jihmaḥ snigdheṣu brāhmaṇeṣu kṣamā anvitaḥ
translated: He should be straightforward with friends, affectionate towards Brahmins, and full of forgiveness.

original: evaṃvṛttasya nṛpateḥ śiloñchenāpi jīvataḥ /
analyzed: evaṃvṛttasya nṛpateḥ śila uñchena api jīvataḥ
translated: Even if a king who conducts himself thus subsists on gleanings and potherbs,

original: vistīryate yaśo loke tailabindur ivāmbhasi // / //
analyzed: vistīryate yaśaḥ loke taila binduḥ iva ambhasi
translated: his fame spreads in the world like a drop of oil in water.

original: atas tu viparītasya nṛpater ajitātmanaḥ /
analyzed: atas tu viparītasya nṛpateḥ ajita ātmanaḥ
translated: But the fame of a king who is contrary to this, whose self is not conquered,

original: saṃkṣipyate yaśo loke ghṛtabindur ivāmbhasi // / //🔽sve sve dharme niviṣṭānāṃ sarveṣām anupūrvaśaḥ /
analyzed: saṃkṣipyate yaśaḥ loke ghṛta binduḥ iva ambhasi  sve sve dharme niviṣṭānām sarveṣām anupūrvaśas
translated: shrinks in the world like a drop of clarified butter in water.

original: varṇānām āśramāṇāṃ ca rājā sṛṣṭo 'bhirakṣitā // / //
analyzed: varṇānām āśramāṇām ca rājā sṛṣṭaḥ abhirakṣitā
translated: The king has been created to protect all the varnas and ashramas, each established in their own dharma, in due order.

original: tena yad yat sabhṛtyena kartavyaṃ rakṣatā prajāḥ /
analyzed: tena yat yat sa bhṛtyena kartavyam rakṣatā prajāḥ
translated: Therefore, whatever needs to be done by him, along with his servants, for the protection of the subjects,

original: tat tad vo 'haṃ pravakṣyāmi yathāvad anupūrvaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: tat tat vaḥ ham pravakṣyāmi yathāvat anupūrvaśas
translated: I shall now describe to you all those duties in due order.

original: brāhmaṇān paryupāsīta prātar utthāya pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇān paryupāsīta prātar utthāya pārthivaḥ
translated: The king should rise early in the morning and attend upon the Brahmanas.

original: traividyavṛddhān viduṣas tiṣṭhet teṣāṃ ca śāsane // / //
analyzed: traividya vṛddhān viduṣaḥ tiṣṭhet teṣām ca śāsane
translated: He should stand in the presence of the learned and the aged who are well-versed in the three Vedas and follow their instructions.

original: vṛddhāṃś ca nityaṃ seveta viprān vedavidaḥ śucīn /
analyzed: vṛddhān ca nityam seveta viprān veda vidaḥ śucīn
translated: He should always serve the aged Brahmanas who are pure and well-versed in the Vedas.

original: vṛddhasevī hi satataṃ rakṣobhir api pūjyate // / //
analyzed: vṛddha sevī hi satatam rakṣobhiḥ api pūjyate
translated: One who serves the aged is always respected even by the Rakshasas.

original: tebhyo 'dhigacched vinayaṃ vinītātmāpi nityaśaḥ /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ dhigacchet vinayam vinīta ātmā api nityaśas
translated: Even though humble himself, he should always learn humility from them.

original: vinītātmā hi nṛpatir na vinaśyati karhi cit // / //
analyzed: vinīta ātmā hi nṛpatiḥ na vinaśyati karhi cit
translated: A king who is humble never perishes.

original: bahavo 'vinayān naṣṭā rājānaḥ saparicchadāḥ /🔽vanasthā api rājyāni vinayāt pratipedire // / //
analyzed: bahavaḥ vinayāt naṣṭāḥ rājānaḥ sa paricchadāḥ  vanasthāḥ api rājyāni vinayāt pratipedire
translated: Many kings with their retinues have perished due to lack of humility.🔽Even forest-dwellers have obtained kingdoms through humility.

original: veno vinaṣṭo 'vinayān nahuṣaś caiva pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: venaḥ vinaṣṭaḥ vinayāt nahuṣaḥ ca eva pārthivaḥ
translated: Vena perished due to lack of humility, as did King Nahusha.

original: sudāḥ paijavanaś caiva sumukho nimir eva ca // / //
analyzed: sudās paijavanaḥ ca eva sumukhaḥ nimiḥ eva ca
translated: Sudâ, Paijavana, Sumukha, and Nimi also (perished).

original: pṛthus tu vinayād rājyaṃ prāptavān manur eva ca /
analyzed: pṛthuḥ tu vinayāt rājyam prāptavān manuḥ eva ca
translated: But Prithu and Manu obtained kingdoms through humility,

original: kuberaś ca dhanaiśvaryaṃ brāhmaṇyaṃ caiva gādhijaḥ // / //
analyzed: kuberaḥ ca dhana aiśvaryam brāhmaṇyam ca eva gādhijaḥ
translated: and Gadhi's son (obtained) wealth and lordship, and Brahmanahood.

original: traividyebhyas trayīṃ vidyāṃ daṇḍanītiṃ ca śāśvatīm /
analyzed: traividyebhyaḥ trayīm vidyām daṇḍanītim ca śāśvatīm
translated: From the three-versed (teachers) he shall learn the three-fold knowledge and the eternal science of government,

original: ānvīkṣikīṃ cātmavidyāṃ vārtārambhāṃś ca lokataḥ // / //
analyzed: ānvīkṣikīm ca ātma vidyām vārttā ārambhān ca lokataḥ
translated: and the science of logic and the knowledge of the soul, and the means of livelihood from the people.

original: indriyāṇāṃ jaye yogaṃ samātiṣṭhed divāniśam /
analyzed: indriyāṇām jaye yogam samātiṣṭhet divāniśam
translated: Day and night he shall apply himself to the practice of controlling his senses,

original: jitendriyo hi śaknoti vaśe sthāpayituṃ prajāḥ // / //
analyzed: jita indriyaḥ hi śaknoti vaśe sthāpayitum prajāḥ
translated: for he who has conquered his senses is able to keep his subjects under control.

original: daśa kāmasamutthāni tathāṣṭau krodhajāni ca /
analyzed: daśa kāma samutthāni tathā aṣṭau krodha jāni ca
translated: The ten vices arising from lust and the eight arising from anger,

original: vyasanāni durantāni prayatnena vivarjayet // / //
analyzed: vyasanāni durantāni prayatnena vivarjayet
translated: these vices which end in ruin he shall carefully avoid.

original: kāmajeṣu prasakto hi vyasaneṣu mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: kāma jeṣu prasaktaḥ hi vyasaneṣu mahīpatiḥ
translated: For a king who is addicted to the vices arising from lust,

original: viyujyate 'rthadharmābhyāṃ krodhajeṣv ātmanaiva tu // / //🔽mṛgayākṣo divāsvapnaḥ parivādaḥ striyo madaḥ /🔽tauryatrikaṃ vṛthāṭyā ca kāmajo daśako gaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: viyujyate ṛtha dharmābhyām krodha jeṣu ātmanā eva tu  mṛgayā akṣaḥ divāsvapnaḥ parivādaḥ striyaḥ madaḥ  tauryatrikam vṛthāṭyā ca kāma jaḥ daśakaḥ gaṇaḥ
translated: is deprived of wealth and virtue, while those arising from anger destroy his very self.🔽Hunting, gambling, sleeping during the day, slander, women, intoxication,🔽the three kinds of music, and wandering about without purpose - this is the group of ten vices arising from lust.

original: paiśunyaṃ sāhasaṃ droha īrṣyāsūyārthadūṣaṇam /
analyzed: paiśunyam sāhasam drohaḥ īrṣyā asūyā artha dūṣaṇam
translated: Slander, violence, treachery, envy, malice, and reviling the scriptures,

original: vāgdaṇḍajaṃ ca pāruṣyaṃ krodhajo 'pi gaṇo 'ṣṭakaḥ // / //🔽dvayor apy etayor mūlaṃ yaṃ sarve kavayo viduḥ /
analyzed: vāgdaṇḍa jam ca pāruṣyam krodha jaḥ pi gaṇaḥ ṣṭakaḥ  dvayoḥ api etayoḥ mūlam yam sarve kavayaḥ viduḥ
translated: and harsh speech and punishment - this is the group of eight vices arising from anger.🔽The root of both these groups is that which all the wise know,

original: taṃ yatnena jayel lobhaṃ tajjāv etāv ubhau gaṇau // / //
analyzed: tam yatnena jayet lobham tad jau etau ubhau gaṇau
translated: he shall therefore carefully conquer greed, for these two groups arise from it.

original: pānam akṣāḥ striyaś caiva mṛgayā ca yathākramam /
analyzed: pānam akṣāḥ striyaḥ ca eva mṛgayā ca yathākramam
translated: Drinking, gambling, women, and hunting, in due order,

original: etat kaṣṭatamaṃ vidyāc catuṣkaṃ kāmaje gaṇe // / //
analyzed: etat kaṣṭatamam vidyāt catuṣkam kāma je gaṇe
translated: one should know these four to be the most pernicious in the group born of desire.

original: daṇḍasya pātanaṃ caiva vākpāruṣyārthadūṣaṇe /
analyzed: daṇḍasya pātanam ca eva vāc pāruṣya artha dūṣaṇe
translated: Causing injury with a staff, harsh speech, and defamation of character,

original: krodhaje 'pi gaṇe vidyāt kaṣṭam etat trikaṃ sadā // / //
analyzed: krodha je gaṇe vidyāt kaṣṭam etat trikam sadā
translated: in the group born of anger, one should always know these three to be the most pernicious.

original: saptakasyāsya vargasya sarvatraivānuṣaṅgiṇaḥ /
analyzed: saptakasya asya vargasya sarvatra eva anuṣaṅgiṇaḥ
translated: Of this group of seven, which is always concomitant,

original: pūrvaṃ pūrvaṃ gurutaraṃ vidyād vyasanam ātmavān // / //
analyzed: pūrvam pūrvam gurutaram vidyāt vyasanam ātmavān
translated: the self-possessed one should know that each preceding one is more serious than the succeeding one.

original: vyasanasya ca mṛtyoś ca vyasanaṃ kaṣṭam ucyate /
analyzed: vyasanasya ca mṛtyoḥ ca vyasanam kaṣṭam ucyate
translated: And of vice and death, vice is said to be more pernicious.

original: vyasany adho 'dho vrajati svar yāty avyasanī mṛtaḥ // / //🔽maulāñ śāstravidaḥ śūrāṃl labdhalakṣān kulodbhavān /
analyzed: vyasanī adhas dhas vrajati svar yāti avyasanī mṛtaḥ  maulām śāstra vidaḥ śūrān labdhalakṣān kula udbhavān
translated: The man given to vice goes lower and lower, while the man free from vice goes to heaven after death.

original: sacivān sapta cāṣṭau vā prakurvīta parīkṣitān // / //
analyzed: sacivān sapta ca aṣṭau vā prakurvīta parīkṣitān
translated: He should appoint as his ministers seven or eight tested men, who are of noble birth, brave, skilled in the scriptures, and have proved their mettle.

original: api yat sukaraṃ karma tad apy ekena duṣkaram /
analyzed: api yat sukaram karma tat api ekena duṣkaram
translated: Even a task that is easy to do is difficult for one alone to do,

original: viśeṣato 'sahāyena kiṃ tu rājyaṃ mahodayam // / //
analyzed: viśeṣataḥ sahāyena kim tu rājyam mahā udayam
translated: how much more so is a kingdom, which is a great undertaking, without an assistant?

original: taiḥ sārdhaṃ cintayen nityaṃ sāmānyaṃ saṃdhivigraham /
analyzed: taiḥ sārdham cintayet nityam sāmānyam saṃdhi vigraham
translated: And he should always consult with them about general matters of peace and war.

original: sthānaṃ samudayaṃ guptiṃ labdhapraśamanāni ca // / //
analyzed: sthānam samudayam guptim labdha praśamanāni ca
translated: the place, the assembly, the secrecy, and the appeasement of those who have been won over.

original: teṣāṃ svaṃ svam abhiprāyam upalabhya pṛthak pṛthak /
analyzed: teṣām svam svam abhiprāyam upalabhya pṛthak pṛthak
translated: Having understood their respective intentions separately,

original: samastānāṃ ca kāryeṣu vidadhyād dhitam ātmanaḥ // / //
analyzed: samastānām ca kāryeṣu vidadhyāt hitam ātmanaḥ
translated: and collectively in matters of work, he should arrange for his own welfare.

original: sarveṣāṃ tu viśiṣṭena brāhmaṇena vipaścitā /
analyzed: sarveṣām tu viśiṣṭena brāhmaṇena vipaścitā
translated: But with the most distinguished one among them, a wise brahmin,

original: mantrayet paramaṃ mantraṃ rājā ṣāḍguṇyasaṃyutam // / //
analyzed: mantrayet paramam mantram rājā ṣāḍguṇya saṃyutam
translated: the king should consult the highest counsel endowed with the six qualities.

original: nityaṃ tasmin samāśvastaḥ sarvakāryāṇi niḥkṣipet /
analyzed: nityam tasmin samāśvastaḥ sarva kāryāṇi niḥkṣipet
translated: Always reassured in him, he should entrust all his affairs.

original: tena sārdhaṃ viniścitya tataḥ karma samārabhet // / //🔽anyān api prakurvīta śucīn prājñān avasthitān /
analyzed: tena sārdham viniścitya tatas karma samārabhet  anyān api prakurvīta śucīn prājñān avasthitān
translated: Having decided with him, he should then commence his work.🔽He should also appoint others who are pure, wise, and steadfast,

original: samyag arthasamāhartṝn amātyān suparīkṣitān // / //
analyzed: samyak artha samāhartṝn amātyān su parīkṣitān
translated: who are well-tested ministers who collect wealth properly.

original: nirvartetāsya yāvadbhir itikartavyatā nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: nirvarteta asya yāvadbhiḥ itikartavya tā nṛbhiḥ
translated: With as many men as are necessary for the performance of his duties,

original: tāvato 'tandritān dakṣān prakurvīta vicakṣaṇān // / //
analyzed: tāvataḥ tandritān dakṣān prakurvīta vicakṣaṇān
translated: he should appoint wise and diligent ones, who are skilled.

original: teṣām arthe niyuñjīta śūrān dakṣān kulodgatān /
analyzed: teṣām arthe niyuñjīta śūrān dakṣān kula udgatān
translated: For their sake, he should employ brave, skilled, and well-born men,

original: śucīn ākarakarmānte bhīrūn antarniveśane // / //
analyzed: śucīn ākara karmānte bhīrūn antar niveśane
translated: pure ones in the mines and workshops, and timid ones in the inner quarters.

original: dūtaṃ caiva prakurvīta sarvaśāstraviśāradam /
analyzed: dūtam ca eva prakurvīta sarva śāstra viśāradam
translated: And he should appoint a messenger who is skilled in all the scriptures,

original: iṅgitākāraceṣṭajñaṃ śuciṃ dakṣaṃ kulodgatam // / //
analyzed: iṅgita ākāra ceṣṭa jñam śucim dakṣam kula udgatam
translated: who knows the gestures, expressions and movements, who is pure, skilled and born in a noble family.

original: anuraktaḥ śucir dakṣaḥ smṛtimān deśakālavit /
analyzed: anuraktaḥ śuciḥ dakṣaḥ smṛtimān deśa kāla vid
translated: A messenger who is devoted, pure, skilled, mindful, knows the right time and place,

original: vapuṣmān vītabhīr vāgmī dūto rājñaḥ praśasyate // / //
analyzed: vapuṣmān vīta bhīḥ vāgmī dūtaḥ rājñaḥ praśasyate
translated: has a good appearance, is fearless, eloquent, is praised as the king's messenger.

original: amātye daṇḍa āyatto daṇḍe vainayikī kriyā /
analyzed: amātye daṇḍaḥ āyattaḥ daṇḍe vainayikī kriyā
translated: Punishment depends on the minister, the act of discipline depends on punishment,

original: nṛpatau kośarāṣṭre ca dūte saṃdhiviparyayau // / //
analyzed: nṛpatau kośa rāṣṭre ca dūte saṃdhi viparyayau
translated: the treasury and kingdom depend on the king, and peace and war depend on the messenger.

original: dūta eva hi saṃdhatte bhinatty eva ca saṃhatān /🔽dūtas tat kurute karma bhidyante yena mānavaḥ // / //
analyzed: dūtaḥ eva hi saṃdhatte bhinatti eva ca saṃhatān  dūtaḥ tat kurute karma bhidyante yena mānavaḥ
translated: The messenger alone makes peace and breaks up alliances,🔽by which the man is divided, that work the messenger does.

original: sa vidyād asya kṛtyeṣu nirgūḍheṅgitaceṣṭitaiḥ /
analyzed: sa vidyāt asya kṛtyeṣu nirgūḍha iṅgita ceṣṭitaiḥ
translated: He should know the king's intentions in his undertakings through hidden gestures and movements,

original: ākāram iṅgitaṃ ceṣṭāṃ bhṛtyeṣu ca cikīrṣitam // / //
analyzed: ākāram iṅgitam ceṣṭām bhṛtyeṣu ca cikīrṣitam
translated: the expression, gestures and movements, and the intentions of the servants.

original: buddhvā ca sarvaṃ tattvena pararājacikīrṣitam /
analyzed: buddhvā ca sarvam tattvena para rāja cikīrṣitam
translated: Having understood all the intentions of the king of another country in reality,

original: tathā prayatnam ātiṣṭhed yathātmānaṃ na pīḍayet // / //🔽jāṅgalaṃ sasyasaṃpannam āryaprāyam anāvilam /
analyzed: tathā prayatnam ātiṣṭhet yathā ātmānam na pīḍayet  jāṅgalam sasya saṃpannam ārya prāyam anāvilam
translated: he should act in such a way as not to harm himself.🔽He should live in a country that is a desert, rich in crops, full of noble people, free from troubles,

original: ramyam ānatasāmantaṃ svājīvyaṃ deśam āvaset // / //
analyzed: ramyam ānata sāmantam su ājīvyam deśam āvaset
translated: pleasant, with neighboring kings bowing down, and suitable for his livelihood.

original: dhanvadurgaṃ mahīdurgam abdurgaṃ vārkṣam eva vā /
analyzed: dhanva durgam mahī durgam ap durgam vārkṣam eva vā
translated: A fortress made of wood, a fortress made of earth, a fortress made of water, or a fortress made of trees,

original: nṛdurgaṃ giridurgaṃ vā samāśritya vaset puram // / //
analyzed: nṛ durgam giri durgam vā samāśritya vaset puram
translated: One should live in a city fortified by men or by a mountain.

original: sarveṇa tu prayatnena giridurgaṃ samāśrayet /
analyzed: sarveṇa tu prayatnena giri durgam samāśrayet
translated: But by all means one should resort to a mountain fortress.

original: eṣāṃ hi bāhuguṇyena giridurgaṃ viśiṣyate // / //🔽triṇy ādyāny āśritās tv eṣāṃ mṛgagartāśrayāpcarāḥ /
analyzed: eṣām hi bāhuguṇyena giri durgam viśiṣyate  triṇi ādyāni āśritāḥ tu eṣām mṛga gartāśraya apcarāḥ
translated: For among these, a mountain fortress is superior by its many qualities.🔽The first three of these are resorted to by deer, by those living in holes, and by aquatic animals.

original: trīṇy uttarāṇi kramaśaḥ plavaṃgamanarāmarāḥ // / //
analyzed: trīṇi uttarāṇi kramaśas plavaṃgama nara amarāḥ
translated: The last three are respectively resorted to by monkeys, men, and immortals.

original: yathā durgāśritān etān nopahiṃsanti śatravaḥ /
analyzed: yathā durga āśritān etān na upahiṃsanti śatravaḥ
translated: Just as these (animals) are not harmed by enemies as long as they resort to their fortresses,

original: tathārayo na hiṃsanti nṛpaṃ durgasamāśritam // / //
analyzed: tathā arayaḥ na hiṃsanti nṛpam durga samāśritam
translated: in the same way enemies do not harm a king who has resorted to a fortress.

original: ekaḥ śataṃ yodhayati prākārastho dhanurdharaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ śatam yodhayati prākāra sthaḥ dhanurdharaḥ
translated: A bowman stationed on a rampart can fight a hundred (enemies).

original: śataṃ daśasahasrāṇi tasmād durgaṃ vidhīyate // / //
analyzed: śatam daśa sahasrāṇi tasmāt durgam vidhīyate
translated: Therefore, a fortress is considered to be (as strong as) a hundred thousand (soldiers).

original: tat syād āyudhasaṃpannaṃ dhanadhānyena vāhanaiḥ /
analyzed: tat syāt āyudha saṃpannam dhana dhānyena vāhanaiḥ
translated: It should be well-supplied with weapons, wealth, grain, and vehicles,

original: brāhmaṇaiḥ śilpibhir yantrair yavasenodakena ca // / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ śilpibhiḥ yantraiḥ yavasena udakena ca
translated: with Brahmins, craftsmen, machines, fodder, and water.

original: tasya madhye suparyāptaṃ kārayed gṛham ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: tasya madhye su paryāptam kārayet gṛham ātmanaḥ
translated: In the middle of that, one should have one's own house built, spacious,

original: guptaṃ sarvartukaṃ śubhraṃ jalavṛkṣasamanvitam // / //
analyzed: guptam sarvartukam śubhram jala vṛkṣa samanvitam
translated: well-protected, suitable for all seasons, bright, with water and trees.

original: tad adhyāsyodvahed bhāryāṃ savarṇāṃ lakṣaṇānvitām /
analyzed: tat adhyāsya udvahet bhāryām savarṇām lakṣaṇa anvitām
translated: Having occupied that, one should marry a wife of the same caste, endowed with good characteristics.

original: kule mahati saṃbhūtāṃ hṛdyāṃ rūpaguṇānvītām // / //
analyzed: kule mahati saṃbhūtām hṛdyām rūpa guṇa anvītām
translated: born in a great family, pleasing, endowed with beauty and good qualities.

original: purohitaṃ ca kurvīta vṛṇuyād eva ca rtvijaḥ /
analyzed: purohitam ca kurvīta vṛṇuyāt eva ca ṛtvijaḥ
translated: And he should appoint a priest, and also choose the priests.

original: te 'sya gṛhyāṇi karmāṇi kuryur vaitānikāni ca // / //
analyzed: te sya gṛhyāṇi karmāṇi kuryuḥ vaitānikāni ca
translated: They should perform his domestic rites and the sacrificial rites.

original: yajeta rājā kratubhir vividhair āptadakṣiṇaiḥ /
analyzed: yajeta rājā kratubhiḥ vividhaiḥ āpta dakṣiṇaiḥ
translated: The king should perform various sacrifices with abundant gifts.

original: dharmārthaṃ caiva viprebhyo dadyād bhogān dhanāni ca // / //
analyzed: dharma artham ca eva viprebhyaḥ dadyāt bhogān dhanāni ca
translated: And for the sake of dharma, he should give enjoyments and wealth to the Brahmins.

original: sāṃvatsarikam āptaiś ca rāṣṭrād āhārayed balim /
analyzed: sāṃvatsarikam āptaiḥ ca rāṣṭrāt āhārayet balim
translated: And through trusted persons, he should collect annual taxes from the kingdom.

original: syāc cāmnāyaparo loke varteta pitṛvan nṛṣu // / //
analyzed: syāt ca āmnāya paraḥ loke varteta pitṛ vat nṛṣu
translated: And he should be devoted to the scriptures in the world, and behave towards men like a father.

original: adhyakṣān vividhān kuryāt tatra tatra vipaścitaḥ /
analyzed: adhyakṣān vividhān kuryāt tatra tatra vipaścitaḥ
translated: He should appoint various learned overseers in different places.

original: te 'sya sarvāṇy avekṣeran nṛṇāṃ kāryāṇi kurvatām // / //
analyzed: te sya sarvāṇi avekṣeran nṛṇām kāryāṇi kurvatām
translated: They should supervise all the activities of men engaged in work.

original: āvṛttānāṃ gurukulād viprāṇāṃ pūjako bhavet /
analyzed: āvṛttānām guru kulāt viprāṇām pūjakaḥ bhavet
translated: He should be the worshipper of Brahmins who have returned from their teacher's house.

original: nṛpāṇām akṣayo hy eṣa nidhir brāhmo 'bhidhīyate // / //
analyzed: nṛpāṇām akṣayaḥ hi eṣa nidhiḥ brāhmaḥ bhidhīyate
translated: This is said to be the inexhaustible treasure of kings, called the Brahminical treasure.

original: na taṃ stenā na cāmitrā haranti na ca naśyati /
analyzed: na tam stenāḥ na ca amitrāḥ haranti na ca naśyati
translated: Neither thieves nor enemies can take it away, nor is it lost.

original: tasmād rājñā nidhātavyo brāhmaṇeṣv akṣayo nidhiḥ // / //
analyzed: tasmāt rājñā nidhātavyaḥ brāhmaṇeṣu akṣayaḥ nidhiḥ
translated: Therefore, the king should deposit an inexhaustible treasure in the Brahmins.

original: na skandate na vyathate na vinaśyati karhi cit /
analyzed: na skandate na vyathate na vinaśyati karhi cit
translated: It does not leak, nor does it suffer, nor is it ever destroyed.

original: variṣṭham agnihotrebhyo brāhmaṇasya mukhe hutam // / //
analyzed: variṣṭham agnihotrebhyaḥ brāhmaṇasya mukhe hutam
translated: The offering made into the mouth of a Brahmana is superior to the Agnihotra.

original: samam abrāhmaṇe dānaṃ dviguṇaṃ brāhmaṇabruve /
analyzed: samam abrāhmaṇe dānam dviguṇam brāhmaṇabruve
translated: A gift to a non-Brahmana is equal, to one who claims to be a Brahmana it is double,

original: prādhīte śatasāhasram anantaṃ vedapārage // / //
analyzed: prādhīte śata sāhasram anantam vedapārage
translated: to one who has mastered the Vedas it is a hundred thousand times, to one who has mastered the Vedanta it is infinite.

original: pātrasya hi viśeṣeṇa śraddadhānatayaiva ca /
analyzed: pātrasya hi viśeṣeṇa śraddadhāna tayā eva ca
translated: For it is by the excellence of the recipient and by faith alone,

original: alpaṃ vā bahu vā pretya dānasya phalam aśnute // / //🔽deśakālavidhānena dravyaṃ śraddhāsamanvitam /
analyzed: alpam vā bahu vā pretya dānasya phalam aśnute  deśa kāla vidhānena dravyam śraddhā samanvitam
translated: that one enjoys the fruit of charity, whether small or great, after death.🔽When a gift is given to a worthy recipient, in accordance with the rules of place and time, with faith,

original: pātre pradīyate yat tu tad dharmasya prasādhanam // / //🔽samottamādhamai rājā tv āhūtaḥ pālayan prajāḥ /
analyzed: pātre pradīyate yat tu tat dharmasya prasādhanam  sama uttama adhamaiḥ rājā tu āhūtaḥ pālayan prajāḥ
translated: that is the fulfillment of dharma.

original: na nivarteta saṃgrāmāt kṣātraṃ dharmam anusmaran // / //
analyzed: na nivarteta saṃgrāmāt kṣātram dharmam anusmaran
translated: A king, while protecting his subjects, should not turn back from battle, remembering the duty of a Kshatriya, when challenged by equals, superiors or inferiors.

original: saṃgrāmeṣv anivartitvaṃ prajānāṃ caiva pālanam /
analyzed: saṃgrāmeṣu anivarti tvam prajānām ca eva pālanam
translated: Not turning back from battle, protecting the people,🔽and serving the Brahmanas, are the greatest good for kings.

original: śuśrūṣā brāhmaṇānāṃ ca rājñāṃ śreyaskaraṃ param // / //🔽āhaveṣu mitho 'nyonyaṃ jighāṃsanto mahīkṣitaḥ /
analyzed: śuśrūṣā brāhmaṇānām ca rājñām śreyaskaram param  āhaveṣu mithas nyonyam jighāṃsantaḥ mahīkṣitaḥ
translated: Kings, desiring to kill each other in battles,

original: yudhyamānāḥ paraṃ śaktyā svargaṃ yānty aparāṅmukhāḥ // / //
analyzed: yudhyamānāḥ param śaktyā svargam yānti a parāṅmukhāḥ
translated: fighting with their utmost strength, facing the enemy, go to heaven.

original: na kūṭair āyudhair hanyād yudhyamāno raṇe ripūn /
analyzed: na kūṭaiḥ āyudhaiḥ hanyāt yudhyamānaḥ raṇe ripūn
translated: One should not strike enemies in battle with deceitful weapons.

original: na karṇibhir nāpi digdhair nāgnijvalitatejanaiḥ // / //
analyzed: na karṇibhiḥ na api digdhaiḥ na agni jvalita tejanaiḥ
translated: Nor with barbed arrows, nor with poisoned arrows, nor with arrows whose shafts are ablaze with fire.

original: na ca hanyāt sthalārūḍhaṃ na klībaṃ na kṛtāñjalim /
analyzed: na ca hanyāt sthala ārūḍham na klībam na kṛtāñjalim
translated: One should not kill one who is on higher ground, nor one who is a eunuch, nor one who has joined the palms in supplication,

original: na muktakeśaṃ nāsīnaṃ na tavāsmīti vādinam // / //🔽na suptaṃ na visaṃnāhaṃ na nagnaṃ na nirāyudham /
analyzed: na mukta keśam na āsīnam na tava asmi iti vādinam  na suptam na visaṃnāham na nagnam na nirāyudham
translated: Nor one whose hair is loose, nor one who is seated, nor one who says I am yours.🔽Nor one who is asleep, nor one who is not wearing armor, nor one who is naked, nor one who is unarmed,

original: nāyudhyamānaṃ paśyantaṃ na pareṇa samāgatam // / //🔽nāyudhavyasanaprāptaṃ nārtaṃ nātiparikṣataṃ /
analyzed: na ayudhyamānam paśyantam na pareṇa samāgatam  na āyudha vyasana prāptam na ārtam na ati parikṣatam
translated: Nor one who is fighting, nor one who is looking on, nor one who is engaged with another.🔽Nor one who has fallen into the calamity of losing his weapons, nor one who is distressed, nor one who is excessively wounded,

original: na bhītaṃ na parāvṛttaṃ satāṃ dharmam anusmaran // / //
analyzed: na bhītam na parāvṛttam satām dharmam anusmaran
translated: Nor one who is frightened, nor one who has turned away, remembering the duty of the virtuous.

original: yas tu bhītaḥ parāvṛttaḥ saṃgrāme hanyate paraiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu bhītaḥ parāvṛttaḥ saṃgrāme hanyate paraiḥ
translated: But one who, frightened, turns away in battle and is killed by the enemy,

original: bhartur yad duṣkṛtaṃ kiṃ cit tat sarvaṃ pratipadyate // / //
analyzed: bhartuḥ yat duṣkṛtam kim cit tat sarvam pratipadyate
translated: Takes upon himself whatever evil his master has done.

original: yac cāsya sukṛtaṃ kiṃ cid amutrārtham upārjitam /
analyzed: yat ca asya su kṛtam kim cit amutrārtham upārjitam
translated: And whatever good he has earned for the sake of the next world,

original: bhartā tat sarvam ādatte parāvṛttahatasya tu // / //
analyzed: bhartā tat sarvam ādatte parāvṛtta hatasya tu
translated: The master takes away all that from one who has turned away and been killed.

original: rathāśvaṃ hastinaṃ chatraṃ dhanaṃ dhānyaṃ paśūn striyaḥ /
analyzed: ratha aśvam hastinam chatram dhanam dhānyam paśūn striyaḥ
translated: The chariot, the horse, the elephant, the umbrella, the wealth, the grain, the cattle, the women,

original: sarvadravyāṇi kupyaṃ ca yo yaj jayati tasya tat // / //
analyzed: sarva dravyāṇi kupyam ca yaḥ yat jayati tasya tat
translated: All the goods and the raw materials - whatever one conquers belongs to him.

original: rājñaś ca dadyur uddhāram ity eṣā vaidikī śrutiḥ /
analyzed: rājñaḥ ca dadyuḥ uddhāram iti eṣā vaidikī śrutiḥ
translated: And they should give a share to the king - this is the Vedic declaration.

original: rājñā ca sarvayodhebhyo dātavyam apṛthagjitam // / //
analyzed: rājñā ca sarva yodhebhyaḥ dātavyam apṛthak jitam
translated: And the king should give to all the warriors what is not conquered separately.

original: eṣo 'nupaskṛtaḥ prokto yodhadharmaḥ sanātanaḥ /
analyzed: eṣaḥ nupaskṛtaḥ proktaḥ yodha dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: This is declared to be the eternal duty of a warrior, not mixed with anything else.

original: asmād dharmān na cyaveta kṣatriyo ghnan raṇe ripūn // / //🔽alabdhaṃ caiva lipseta labdhaṃ rakṣet prayatnataḥ /
analyzed: asmāt dharmāt na cyaveta kṣatriyaḥ ghnan raṇe ripūn  alabdham ca eva lipseta labdham rakṣet prayatnataḥ
translated: A Kshatriya should not deviate from this duty while killing enemies in battle.🔽One should seek to acquire what has not been acquired, and should carefully protect what has been acquired.

original: rakṣitaṃ vardhayec caiva vṛddhaṃ pātreṣu nikṣipet // / //
analyzed: rakṣitam vardhayet ca eva vṛddham pātreṣu nikṣipet
translated: What has been protected should be increased, and what has been increased should be bestowed upon worthy recipients.

original: etac caturvidhaṃ vidyāt puruṣārthaprayojanam /
analyzed: etat caturvidham vidyāt puruṣa artha prayojanam
translated: One should know these four as the purposes of human endeavor.

original: asya nityam anuṣṭhānaṃ samyak kuryād atandritaḥ // / //🔽alabdham icched daṇḍena labdhaṃ rakṣed avekṣayā /
analyzed: asya nityam anuṣṭhānam samyak kuryāt atandritaḥ  alabdham icchet daṇḍena labdham rakṣet avekṣayā
translated: One should always perform these properly without negligence.🔽One should seek to acquire what has not been acquired through punishment, and should protect what has been acquired through foresight.

original: rakṣitaṃ vardhayed vṛddhyā vṛddhaṃ pātreṣu nikṣipet // / //🔽nityam udyatadaṇḍaḥ syān nityaṃ vivṛtapauruṣaḥ /
analyzed: rakṣitam vardhayet vṛddhyā vṛddham pātreṣu nikṣipet  nityam udyata daṇḍaḥ syāt nityam vivṛta pauruṣaḥ
translated: What has been protected should be increased through growth, and what has been increased should be bestowed upon worthy recipients.🔽One should always have one's punishment ready, always one's manliness displayed,

original: nityaṃ saṃvṛtasaṃvāryo nityaṃ chidrānusāry areḥ // / //
analyzed: nityam saṃvṛta saṃvāryaḥ nityam chidra anusārī areḥ
translated: always one's defenses well-guarded, always one's eye on the enemy's weak points.

original: nityam udyatadaṇḍasya kṛtsnam udvijate jagat /
analyzed: nityam udyata daṇḍasya kṛtsnam udvijate jagat
translated: The whole world trembles before one whose punishment is always ready.

original: tasmāt sarvāṇi bhūtāni daṇḍenaiva prasādhayet // / //
analyzed: tasmāt sarvāṇi bhūtāni daṇḍena eva prasādhayet
translated: Therefore, one should subdue all beings by punishment alone.

original: amāyayaiva varteta na kathaṃ cana māyayā /
analyzed: amāyayā eva varteta na katham cana māyayā
translated: One should conduct oneself only through honesty, never through deceit.

original: budhyetāriprayuktāṃ ca māyāṃ nityaṃ susaṃvṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: budhyeta ari prayuktām ca māyām nityam su saṃvṛtaḥ
translated: One should always be well-guarded and understand the deceit employed by the enemy.

original: nāsya chidraṃ paro vidyād vidyāc chidraṃ parasya ca /🔽gūhet kūrma ivāṅgāni rakṣed vivaram ātmanaḥ // / //🔽bakavac cintayed arthān siṃhavac ca parākrame /
analyzed: na asya chidram paraḥ vidyāt vidyāt chidram parasya ca  gūhet kūrmaḥ iva aṅgāni rakṣet vivaram ātmanaḥ  baka vat cintayet arthān siṃha vat ca parākrame
translated: The enemy should not know one's weakness, but one should know the enemy's weakness.🔽One should conceal one's limbs like a tortoise, and guard one's own weakness.🔽One should think about wealth like a crane, and be valorous like a lion.

original: vṛkavac cāvalumpeta śaśavac ca viniṣpatet // / //
analyzed: vṛka vat ca avalumpeta śaśa vat ca viniṣpatet
translated: One should pounce like a wolf, and escape like a hare.

original: evaṃ vijayamānasya ye 'sya syuḥ paripanthinaḥ /
analyzed: evam vijayamānasya ye sya syuḥ paripanthinaḥ
translated: Thus, those who would obstruct one who is conquering in this way,

original: tān ānayed vaśaṃ sarvān sāmādibhir upakramaiḥ // / //
analyzed: tān ānayet vaśam sarvān sāma ādibhiḥ upakramaiḥ
translated: one should bring all of them under control through the means such as conciliation.

original: yadi te tu na tiṣṭheyur upāyaiḥ prathamais tribhiḥ /
analyzed: yadi te tu na tiṣṭheyuḥ upāyaiḥ prathamaiḥ tribhiḥ
translated: If they do not stand firm through the first three means,

original: daṇḍenaiva prasahyaitāñ śanakair vaśam ānayet // / //🔽sāmādīnām upāyānāṃ caturṇām api paṇḍitāḥ /
analyzed: daṇḍena eva prasahya etām śanakais vaśam ānayet  sāma ādīnām upāyānām caturṇām api paṇḍitāḥ
translated: one should gradually bring them under control by force alone through punishment.🔽The wise ones always praise conciliation and punishment among the four means,

original: sāmadaṇḍau praśaṃsanti nityaṃ rāṣṭrābhivṛddhaye // / //
analyzed: sāma daṇḍau praśaṃsanti nityam rāṣṭra abhivṛddhaye
translated: for the constant growth of the kingdom.

original: yathoddharati nirdātā kakṣaṃ dhānyaṃ ca rakṣati /
analyzed: yathā uddharati nirdātā kakṣam dhānyam ca rakṣati
translated: Just as a winnower removes chaff and preserves the grain,

original: tathā rakṣen nṛpo rāṣṭraṃ hanyāc ca paripanthinaḥ // / //
analyzed: tathā rakṣet nṛpaḥ rāṣṭram hanyāt ca paripanthinaḥ
translated: and protect the kingdom in the same way, and kill those who obstruct him.

original: mohād rājā svarāṣṭraṃ yaḥ karṣayaty anavekṣayā /
analyzed: mohāt rājā sva rāṣṭram yaḥ karṣayati anavekṣayā
translated: The king who out of delusion oppresses his own kingdom without consideration,

original: so 'cirād bhraśyate rājyāj jīvitāc ca sabāndhavaḥ // / //
analyzed: saḥ cirāt bhraśyate rājyāt jīvitāt ca sa bāndhavaḥ
translated: he soon falls from his kingdom and from life along with his relatives.

original: śarīrakarṣaṇāt prāṇāḥ kṣīyante prāṇināṃ yathā /
analyzed: śarīra karṣaṇāt prāṇāḥ kṣīyante prāṇinām yathā
translated: Just as the life-breaths of living beings are diminished by the emaciation of the body,

original: tathā rājñām api prāṇāḥ kṣīyante rāṣṭrakarṣaṇāt // / //
analyzed: tathā rājñām api prāṇāḥ kṣīyante rāṣṭra karṣaṇāt
translated: in the same way, the life-breaths of kings are diminished by the emaciation of the kingdom.

original: rāṣṭrasya saṃgrahe nityaṃ vidhānam idam ācaret /
analyzed: rāṣṭrasya saṃgrahe nityam vidhānam idam ācaret
translated: One should always follow this rule in collecting the kingdom.

original: susaṃgṛhītarāṣṭre hi pārthivaḥ sukham edhate // / //
analyzed: su saṃgṛhīta rāṣṭre hi pārthivaḥ sukham edhate
translated: For the king prospers in happiness when the kingdom is well-governed.

original: dvayos trayāṇāṃ pañcānāṃ madhye gulmam adhiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: dvayoḥ trayāṇām pañcānām madhye gulmam adhiṣṭhitam
translated: A group should be established in the middle of two, three, or five,

original: tathā grāmaśatānāṃ ca kuryād rāṣṭrasya saṃgraham // / //
analyzed: tathā grāma śatānām ca kuryāt rāṣṭrasya saṃgraham
translated: and in the same way, one should collect the kingdom in the middle of a hundred villages.

original: grāmasyādhipatiṃ kuryād daśagrāmapatiṃ tathā /
analyzed: grāmasya adhipatim kuryāt daśa grāma patim tathā
translated: One should appoint a chief of a village, and likewise a chief of ten villages,

original: viṃśatīśaṃ śateśaṃ ca sahasrapatim eva ca // / //
analyzed: viṃśati īśam śata īśam ca sahasra patim eva ca
translated: a chief of twenty, a chief of a hundred, and a chief of a thousand.

original: grāmadoṣān samutpannān grāmikaḥ śanakaiḥ svayam /
analyzed: grāma doṣān samutpannān grāmikaḥ śanakais svayam
translated: The village headman himself should quietly report the faults that arise in the village

original: śaṃsed grāmadaśeśāya daśeśo viṃśatīśine // / //
analyzed: śaṃset grāma daśa īśāya daśa īśaḥ viṃśati īśine
translated: to the chief of ten villages, and the chief of ten villages to the chief of twenty.

original: viṃśatīśas tu tat sarvaṃ śateśāya nivedayet /
analyzed: viṃśati īśaḥ tu tat sarvam śata īśāya nivedayet
translated: The chief of twenty should report all that to the chief of a hundred,🔽and the chief of a hundred should report to the chief of a thousand.

original: śaṃsed grāmaśateśas tu sahasrapataye svayam // / //🔽yāni rājapradeyāni pratyahaṃ grāmavāsibhiḥ /
analyzed: śaṃset grāma śata īśaḥ tu sahasra pataye svayam  yāni rāja pradeyāni pratyaham grāma vāsibhiḥ
translated: The lord of a hundred villages should himself report to the lord of a thousand villages.🔽The food, drink, fuel, and other things that the villagers should give to the king every day,

original: annapānendhanādīni grāmikas tāny avāpnuyāt // / //
analyzed: anna pāna indhana ādīni grāmikaḥ tāni avāpnuyāt
translated: the village headman should obtain those.

original: daśī kulaṃ tu bhuñjīta viṃśī pañca kulāni ca /
analyzed: daśī kulam tu bhuñjīta viṃśī pañca kulāni ca
translated: The lord of ten villages should enjoy five villages, and the lord of twenty villages should enjoy ten villages.

original: grāmaṃ grāmaśatādhyakṣaḥ sahasrādhipatiḥ puram // / //
analyzed: grāmam grāma śata adhyakṣaḥ sahasra adhipatiḥ puram
translated: The lord of a hundred villages should enjoy one village, and the lord of a thousand villages should enjoy a city.

original: teṣāṃ grāmyāṇi kāryāni pṛthakkāryāṇi caiva hi /
analyzed: teṣām grāmyāṇi kāryāni pṛthakkāryāṇi ca eva hi
translated: Their duties related to the villages and their separate duties,

original: rājño 'nyaḥ sacivaḥ snigdhas tāni paśyed atandritaḥ // / //
analyzed: rājñaḥ sacivaḥ snigdhaḥ tāni paśyet atandritaḥ
translated: another minister of the king, who is friendly, should carefully examine those.

original: nagare nagare caikaṃ kuryāt sarvārthacintakam /
analyzed: nagare nagare ca ekam kuryāt sarva artha cintakam
translated: In every city, he should appoint one person to think about all matters,

original: uccaiḥsthānaṃ ghorarūpaṃ nakṣatrāṇām iva graham // / //
analyzed: uccais sthānam ghora rūpam nakṣatrāṇām iva graham
translated: who is in a high position, has a terrible form, like a planet among the stars.

original: sa tān anuparikrāmet sarvān eva sadā svayam /
analyzed: sa tān anuparikrāmet sarvān eva sadā svayam
translated: He should always himself go around all of them.

original: teṣāṃ vṛttaṃ pariṇayet samyag rāṣṭreṣu taccaraiḥ // / //
analyzed: teṣām vṛttam pariṇayet samyak rāṣṭreṣu tad caraiḥ
translated: He should properly examine their conduct in the country through his spies.

original: rājño hi rakṣādhikṛtāḥ parasvādāyinaḥ śaṭhāḥ /
analyzed: rājñaḥ hi rakṣā adhikṛtāḥ para sva ādāyinaḥ śaṭhāḥ
translated: The servants appointed for the king's protection, who are deceitful and take away the wealth of others,

original: bhṛtyā bhavanti prāyeṇa tebhyo rakṣed imāḥ prajāḥ // / //
analyzed: bhṛtyāḥ bhavanti prāyeṇa tebhyaḥ rakṣet imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: are mostly such. He should protect the people from them.

original: ye kāryikebhyo 'rtham eva gṛhṇīyuḥ pāpacetasaḥ /
analyzed: ye kāryikebhyaḥ rtham eva gṛhṇīyuḥ pāpa cetasaḥ
translated: Those who, with evil intentions, take money only from the officials,

original: teṣāṃ sarvasvam ādāya rājā kuryāt pravāsanam // / //🔽rājā karmasu yuktānāṃ strīṇāṃ preṣyajanasya ca /
analyzed: teṣām sarva svam ādāya rājā kuryāt pravāsanam  rājā karmasu yuktānām strīṇām preṣya janasya ca
translated: Having confiscated all their property, the king should banish them.

original: pratyahaṃ kalpayed vṛttiṃ sthānaṃ karmānurūpataḥ // / //🔽paṇo deyo 'vakṛṣṭasya ṣaḍ utkṛṣṭasya vetanam /
analyzed: pratyaham kalpayet vṛttim sthānam karma anurūpataḥ  paṇaḥ deyaḥ vakṛṣṭasya ṣaṣ utkṛṣṭasya vetanam
translated: The king should daily provide subsistence and quarters to women and servants engaged in work, in accordance with their position and work.🔽A fine of one pana should be imposed on a low person, and six on a high one.

original: ṣāṇmāsikas tathācchādo dhānyadroṇas tu māsikaḥ // / //🔽krayavikrayam adhvānaṃ bhaktaṃ ca saparivyayam /
analyzed: ṣāṇmāsikaḥ tathā ācchādaḥ dhānya droṇaḥ tu māsikaḥ  kraya vikrayam adhvānam bhaktam ca sa parivyayam
translated: Clothing should be provided every six months, and one drona of grain every month.

original: yogakṣemaṃ ca saṃprekṣya vaṇijo dāpayet karān // / //🔽yathā phalena yujyeta rājā kartā ca karmaṇām /
analyzed: yogakṣemam ca saṃprekṣya vaṇijaḥ dāpayet karān  yathā phalena yujyeta rājā kartā ca karmaṇām
translated: Considering the purchase and sale, the journey, the food, and the expenses, the king should impose taxes on traders, taking into account their profits and losses.

original: tathāvekṣya nṛpo rāṣṭre kalpayet satataṃ karān // / //
analyzed: tathā avekṣya nṛpaḥ rāṣṭre kalpayet satatam karān
translated: The king should always impose taxes in the kingdom, considering how he may be connected with the fruits and the doer with the results of actions.

original: yathālpālpam adanty ādyaṃ vāryokovatsaṣaṭpadāḥ /
analyzed: yathā alpa alpam adanti ādyam vāryokaḥ vatsa ṣaṭpadāḥ
translated: Just as ants, cows, and bees take little by little,

original: tathālpālpo grahītavyo rāṣṭrād rājñābdikaḥ karaḥ // / //
analyzed: tathā alpa alpaḥ grahītavyaḥ rāṣṭrāt rājñā ābdikaḥ karaḥ
translated: so the king should collect an annual tax from the kingdom little by little.

original: pañcāśadbhāga ādeyo rājñā paśuhiraṇyayoḥ /
analyzed: pañcāśat bhāgaḥ ādeyaḥ rājñā paśu hiraṇyayoḥ
translated: The king should take one-fiftieth of the value of cattle and gold,

original: dhānyānām aṣṭamo bhāgaḥ ṣaṣṭho dvādaśa eva vā // / //
analyzed: dhānyānām aṣṭamaḥ bhāgaḥ ṣaṣṭhaḥ dvādaśaḥ eva vā
translated: one-eighth, one-sixth, or one-twelfth of the value of grains.

original: ādadītātha ṣaḍbhāgaṃ drumāṃsamadhusarpiṣām /
analyzed: ādadīta atha ṣaḍbhāgam dru māṃsa madhu sarpiṣām
translated: The king should take one-sixth of the value of trees, meat, honey, and ghee.

original: gandhauṣadhirasānāṃ ca puṣpamūlaphalasya ca // / //🔽patraśākatṛṇānāṃ ca carmaṇāṃ vaidalasya ca /
analyzed: gandha oṣadhi rasānām ca puṣpa mūla phalasya ca  patra śāka tṛṇānām ca carmaṇām vaidalasya ca
translated: And of perfumes, herbs, juices, flowers, roots, and fruits,🔽Of leaves, vegetables, and grass, of leather and split bamboo,

original: mṛnmayānāṃ ca bhāṇḍānāṃ sarvasyāśmamayasya ca // / //🔽mriyamāṇo 'py ādadīta na rājā śrotriyāt karam /
analyzed: mṛd mayānām ca bhāṇḍānām sarvasya aśma mayasya ca  mriyamāṇaḥ u pi ādadīta na rājā śrotriyāt karam
translated: And of all earthenware vessels and stone implements,🔽Even when dying, the king should not take taxes from a learned Brahmin.

original: na ca kṣudhāsya saṃsīdec chrotriyo viṣaye vasan // / //
analyzed: na ca kṣudhā asya saṃsīdet śrotriyaḥ viṣaye vasan
translated: A learned Brahmin residing in his kingdom should not suffer from hunger.

original: yasya rājñas tu viṣaye śrotriyaḥ sīdati kṣudhā /
analyzed: yasya rājñaḥ tu viṣaye śrotriyaḥ sīdati kṣudhā
translated: If a learned Brahmin suffers from hunger in a king's kingdom,

original: tasyāpi tat kṣudhā rāṣṭram acirenaiva sīdati // / //
analyzed: tasya api tat kṣudhā rāṣṭram acirena eva sīdati
translated: Then that kingdom will soon suffer from hunger.

original: śrutavṛtte viditvāsya vṛttiṃ dharmyāṃ prakalpayet /
analyzed: śruta vṛtte viditvā asya vṛttim dharmyām prakalpayet
translated: Having known his learning and conduct, the king should arrange a righteous livelihood for him.

original: saṃrakṣet sarvataś cainaṃ pitā putram ivāurasam // / //
analyzed: saṃrakṣet sarvatas ca enam pitā putram iva aurasam
translated: He should protect him in every way, like a father his own son.

original: saṃrakṣyamāṇo rājñā yaṃ kurute dharmam anvaham /
analyzed: saṃrakṣyamāṇaḥ rājñā yam kurute dharmam anvaham
translated: The king, being protected by the king, performs his duties daily.

original: tenāyur vardhate rājño draviṇaṃ rāṣṭram eva ca // / //
analyzed: tena āyuḥ vardhate rājñaḥ draviṇam rāṣṭram eva ca
translated: By that, the king's lifespan, wealth, and kingdom increase.

original: yat kiṃ cid api varṣasya dāpayet karasaṃjñitam /
analyzed: yat kim cit api varṣasya dāpayet kara saṃjñitam
translated: Whatever is given in the name of tax, even if it is very little,

original: vyavahāreṇa jīvantaṃ rājā rāṣṭre pṛthagjanam // / //
analyzed: vyavahāreṇa jīvantam rājā rāṣṭre pṛthagjanam
translated: The king should collect it from every individual living by trade in the kingdom.

original: kārukāñ śilpinaś caiva śūdrāṃs cātmopajīvinaḥ /
analyzed: kārukām śilpinaḥ ca eva śūdrān ca ātma upajīvinaḥ
translated: Artisans, craftsmen, and Shudras who depend on themselves,

original: ekaikaṃ kārayet karma māsi māsi mahīpatiḥ // / //🔽nocchindyād ātmano mūlaṃ pareṣāṃ cātitṛṣṇayā /
analyzed: ekaikam kārayet karma māsi māsi mahīpatiḥ  na ucchindyāt ātmanaḥ mūlam pareṣām ca ati tṛṣṇayā
translated: The king should cause each of these acts to be done every month.🔽He should not cut off his own roots or those of others through excessive greed.

original: ucchindan hy ātmano mūlam āṭmānaṃ tāṃś ca pīdayet // / //🔽tīkṣṇaś caiva mṛduś ca syāt kāryaṃ vīkṣya mahīpatiḥ /🔽tīkṣṇaś caiva mṛduś caiva rāja bhavati sammataḥ // / //
analyzed: ucchindan hi ātmanaḥ mūlam āṭmānam tān ca pīdayet  tīkṣṇaḥ ca eva mṛduḥ ca syāt kāryam vīkṣya mahīpatiḥ  tīkṣṇaḥ ca eva mṛduḥ ca eva rāja bhavati sammataḥ
translated: For by cutting off his own roots, he would afflict himself and them.🔽The king should be both stern and mild, considering what needs to be done.🔽A king who is both stern and mild is considered righteous.

original: amātyamukhyaṃ dharmajñaṃ prājñaṃ dāntaṃ kulodgatam /
analyzed: amātya mukhyam dharma jñam prājñam dāntam kula udgatam
translated: He should appoint as his chief minister a righteous, wise, self-controlled person born in a noble family.

original: sthāpayed āsane tasmin khinnaḥ kāryekṣaṇe nṛṇām // / //
analyzed: sthāpayet āsane tasmin khinnaḥ kārya īkṣaṇe nṛṇām
translated: When tired of overseeing the affairs of men, he should sit on that seat.

original: evaṃ sarvaṃ vidhāyedam itikartavyam ātmanaḥ /🔽yuktaś caivāpramattaś ca parirakṣed imāḥ prajāḥ // / //
analyzed: evam sarvam vidhāya idam itikartavyam ātmanaḥ  yuktaḥ ca eva apramattaḥ ca parirakṣet imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: Having thus arranged all this that needs to be done by himself,🔽he should protect these people righteously and with vigilance.

original: vikrośantyo yasya rāṣṭrād hriyante dasyubhiḥ prajāḥ /
analyzed: vikrośantyaḥ yasya rāṣṭrāt hriyante dasyubhiḥ prajāḥ
translated: He who, while seeing and with his servants, allows the people of his kingdom to be carried off by robbers while crying out,

original: saṃpaśyataḥ sabhṛtyasya mṛtaḥ sa na tu jīvati // / //🔽kṣatriyasya paro dharmaḥ prājānām eva pālanam /
analyzed: saṃpaśyataḥ sa bhṛtyasya mṛtaḥ sa na tu jīvati  kṣatriyasya paraḥ dharmaḥ prājānām eva pālanam
translated: he is dead, not alive.🔽The highest duty of a kshatriya is the protection of the people.

original: nirdiṣṭaphalabhoktā hi rājā dharmeṇa yujyate // / //
analyzed: nirdiṣṭa phala bhoktā hi rājā dharmeṇa yujyate
translated: For a king who enjoys the fruits prescribed by the scriptures becomes righteous.

original: utthāya paścime yāme kṛtaśaucaḥ samāhitaḥ /
analyzed: utthāya paścime yāme kṛta śaucaḥ samāhitaḥ
translated: Rising in the last watch of the night, having purified himself, and being composed,

original: hutāgnir brāhmaṇāṃś cārcya praviśet sa śubhāṃ sabhām // / //
analyzed: huta agniḥ brāhmaṇān ca arcya praviśet sa śubhām sabhām
translated: having offered oblations into the fire and worshipped the Brahmins, he should enter the auspicious assembly hall.

original: tatra sthitaḥ prajāḥ sarvāḥ pratinandya visarjayet /
analyzed: tatra sthitaḥ prajāḥ sarvāḥ pratinandya visarjayet
translated: Having sat there, he should greet all the subjects and dismiss them.

original: visṛjya ca prajāḥ sarvā mantrayet saha mantribhiḥ // / //🔽giripṛṣṭhaṃ samāruhya prasādaṃ vā rahogataḥ /
analyzed: visṛjya ca prajāḥ sarvāḥ mantrayet saha mantribhiḥ  giri pṛṣṭham samāruhya prasādam vā rahaḥ gataḥ
translated: Having dismissed all the subjects, he should consult with his ministers.🔽Having ascended a mountain peak or a terrace, or having gone to a secluded place,

original: araṇye niḥśalāke vā mantrayed avibhāvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: araṇye niḥśalāke vā mantrayet a vibhāvitaḥ
translated: he should consult, unobserved, in a forest or a place without people.🔽The king who rules the entire earth, even if he lacks a treasury,

original: yasya mantraṃ na jānanti samāgamya pṛthagjanāḥ /🔽sa kṛtsnāṃ pṛthivīṃ bhuṅkte kośahīno 'pi pārthivaḥ // / //
analyzed: yasya mantram na jānanti samāgamya pṛthagjanāḥ  sa kṛtsnām pṛthivīm bhuṅkte kośa hīnaḥ pi pārthivaḥ
translated: whose counsel, when consulted separately, is not known by ordinary people.

original: jaḍamūkāndhabadhirāṃs tairyagyonān vayo'tigān /
analyzed: jaḍa mūka andha badhirān tairyagyonān vayotigān
translated: The dull, the mute, the blind, the deaf, those born as animals, those who have passed their youth,

original: strīmlecchavyādhitavyaṅgān mantrakāle 'pasārayet // / //🔽bhindanty avamatā mantraṃ tairyagyonās tathaiva ca /
analyzed: strī mleccha vyādhita vyaṅgān mantra kāle  bhindanti avamatāḥ mantram tairyagyonāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: women, barbarians, the sick, and the deformed, he should remove them at the time of counsel.

original: striyaś caiva viśeṣeṇa tasmāt tatrādṛto bhavet // / //
analyzed: striyaḥ ca eva viśeṣeṇa tasmāt tatra ādṛtaḥ bhavet
translated: Those who are despised, those born as animals, and especially women, break the counsel, therefore he should be heedful in that regard.

original: madhyaṃdine 'rdharātre vā viśrānto vigataklamaḥ /
analyzed: madhyaṃdine ṛdharātre vā viśrāntaḥ vigata klamaḥ
translated: At midday or midnight, having rested and being free from fatigue,

original: cintayed dharmakāmārthān sārdhaṃ tair eka eva vā // / //
analyzed: cintayet dharma kāma arthān sārdham taiḥ ekaḥ eva vā
translated: He should think about Dharma, Kama and Artha, either alone or together with them.

original: parasparaviruddhānāṃ teṣāṃ ca samupārjanam /🔽kanyānāṃ saṃpradānaṃ ca kumārāṇāṃ ca rakṣaṇaṃ // / //🔽dūtasaṃpreṣaṇaṃ caiva kāryaśeṣaṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: paraspara viruddhānām teṣām ca samupārjanam  kanyānām saṃpradānam ca kumārāṇām ca rakṣaṇam  dūta saṃpreṣaṇam ca eva kārya śeṣam tathā eva ca
translated: The acquisition of those which are mutually contradictory,🔽The bestowal of daughters and the protection of princes,🔽The dispatch of envoys and the remaining tasks,

original: antaḥpurapracāraṃ ca praṇidhīnāṃ ca ceṣṭitam // / //
analyzed: antaḥpura pracāram ca praṇidhīnām ca ceṣṭitam
translated: The conduct in the inner quarters and the activities of the spies,

original: kṛtsnaṃ cāṣṭavidhaṃ karma pañcavargaṃ ca tattvataḥ /
analyzed: kṛtsnam ca aṣṭavidham karma pañcavargam ca tattvataḥ
translated: The entire eight-fold work and the five groups truly,

original: anurāgāparāgau ca pracāraṃ maṇḍalasya ca // / //🔽madhyamasya pracāraṃ ca vijīgiṣoś ca ceṣṭitam /
analyzed: anurāga aparāgau ca pracāram maṇḍalasya ca  madhyamasya pracāram ca vijīgiṣoḥ ca ceṣṭitam
translated: Affection and disaffection, and the conduct of the circle,🔽The conduct of the neutral and the efforts of the enemy,

original: udāsīnapracāraṃ ca śatroś caiva prayatnataḥ // / //
analyzed: udāsīna pracāram ca śatroḥ ca eva prayatnataḥ
translated: The conduct of the neutral and the efforts of the enemy,

original: etāḥ prakṛtayo mūlaṃ maṇḍalasya samāsataḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ prakṛtayaḥ mūlam maṇḍalasya samāsatas
translated: These are the fundamental types of the circle in brief,

original: aṣṭau cānyāḥ samākhyātā dvādaśaiva tu tāḥ smṛtāḥ // / //
analyzed: aṣṭau ca anyāḥ samākhyātāḥ dvādaśā eva tu tāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: And eight others are mentioned, thus they are remembered as twelve.

original: amātyarāṣṭradurgārtha daṇḍākhyāḥ pañca cāparāḥ /
analyzed: amātya rāṣṭra durga artha daṇḍa ākhyāḥ pañca ca aparāḥ
translated: The five others called ministers, country, fort, wealth and army,

original: pratyekaṃ kathitā hy etāḥ saṃkṣepeṇa dvisaptatiḥ // / //
analyzed: pratyekam kathitāḥ hi etāḥ saṃkṣepeṇa dvisaptatiḥ
translated: These are separately mentioned, thus in brief seventy-two,

original: anantaram ariṃ vidyād arisevinam eva ca /
analyzed: anantaram arim vidyāt ari sevinam eva ca
translated: After that one should know the enemy and also the servant of the enemy,

original: arer anantaraṃ mitram udāsīnaṃ tayoḥ param // / //
analyzed: areḥ anantaram mitram udāsīnam tayoḥ param
translated: The enemy's immediate neighbor is his friend, and the neutral king is beyond these two.

original: tān sarvān abhisaṃdadhyāt sāmādibhir upakramaiḥ /
analyzed: tān sarvān abhisaṃdadhyāt sāma ādibhiḥ upakramaiḥ
translated: He should employ all of them with conciliation and other means,

original: vyastaiś caiva samastaiś ca pauruṣeṇa nayena ca // / //🔽saṃdhiṃ ca vigrahaṃ caiva yānam āsanam eva ca /
analyzed: vyastaiḥ ca eva samastaiḥ ca pauruṣeṇa nayena ca  saṃdhim ca vigraham ca eva yānam āsanam eva ca
translated: Both separately and collectively, and with the policy of manliness.🔽He should always consider the six expedients: peace, war, march, halt,

original: dvaidhībhāvaṃ saṃśrayaṃ ca ṣaḍguṇāṃś cintayet sadā // / //🔽āsanaṃ caiva yānaṃ ca saṃdhiṃ vigraham eva ca /
analyzed: dvaidhībhāvam saṃśrayam ca ṣaḍguṇān cintayet sadā  āsanam ca eva yānam ca saṃdhim vigraham eva ca
translated: Duplicity, and seeking shelter.🔽He should employ halt, march, peace, and war,

original: kāryaṃ vīkṣya prayuñjīta dvaidhaṃ saṃśrayam eva ca // / //
analyzed: kāryam vīkṣya prayuñjīta dvaidham saṃśrayam eva ca
translated: And also duplicity and seeking shelter, considering the task.

original: saṃdhiṃ tu dvividhaṃ vidyād rājā vigraham eva ca /
analyzed: saṃdhim tu dvividham vidyāt rājā vigraham eva ca
translated: The king should know that peace and war are of two kinds each,

original: ubhe yānāsane caiva dvividhaḥ saṃśrayaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: ubhe yāna āsane ca eva dvividhaḥ saṃśrayaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: And march and halt are also of two kinds each; seeking shelter is said to be of two kinds.

original: samānayānakarmā ca viparītas tathaiva ca /
analyzed: samāna yāna karmā ca viparītaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: One is of the same march and action, and the other is the opposite.

original: tadā tv āyatisaṃyuktaḥ saṃdhir jñeyo dvilakṣaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: tadā tu āyati saṃyuktaḥ saṃdhiḥ jñeyaḥ dvi lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Then, peace is to be known as having two characteristics, connected with the future.

original: svayaṃkṛtaś ca kāryārtham akāle kāla eva vā /
analyzed: svayaṃkṛtaḥ ca kārya artham akāle kālaḥ eva vā
translated: One is made by oneself for the sake of the task, either at the wrong time or at the right time,

original: mitrasya caivāpakṛte dvividho vigrahaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: mitrasya ca eva apakṛte dvividhaḥ vigrahaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: And the other is war, remembered as of two kinds, when a friend has been wronged.

original: ekākinaś cātyayike kārye prāpte yadṛcchayā /
analyzed: ekākinaḥ ca ātyayike kārye prāpte yadṛcchayā
translated: And when a solitary king is faced with an urgent task that has unexpectedly arisen,

original: saṃhatasya ca mitreṇa dvividhaṃ yānam ucyate // / //
analyzed: saṃhatasya ca mitreṇa dvividham yānam ucyate
translated: And for one who has combined with a friend, two kinds of movement are mentioned.

original: kṣīṇasya caiva kramaśo daivāt pūrvakṛtena vā /
analyzed: kṣīṇasya ca eva kramaśas daivāt pūrva kṛtena vā
translated: And for one who is gradually declining, either by fate or due to past actions,

original: mitrasya cānurodhena dvividhaṃ smṛtam āsanam // / //
analyzed: mitrasya ca anurodhena dvividham smṛtam āsanam
translated: And for one who is following the advice of a friend, two kinds of sitting are remembered.

original: balasya svāminaś caiva sthitiḥ kāryārthasiddhaye /
analyzed: balasya svāminaḥ ca eva sthitiḥ kārya artha siddhaye
translated: For the sake of the stability and accomplishment of the purpose,

original: dvividhaṃ kīrtyate dvaidhaṃ ṣāḍguṇyaguṇavedibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: dvividham kīrtyate dvaidham ṣāḍguṇya guṇa vedibhiḥ
translated: The two kinds of division are declared by those who know the qualities of the sixfold policy.

original: arthasaṃpādanārthaṃ ca pīḍyamānasya śatrubhiḥ /
analyzed: artha saṃpādana artham ca pīḍyamānasya śatrubhiḥ
translated: And for the sake of accomplishing wealth, when one is oppressed by enemies,

original: sādhuṣu vyapadeśaś ca dvividhaḥ saṃśrayaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: sādhuṣu vyapadeśaḥ ca dvividhaḥ saṃśrayaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: And for the sake of being known among the virtuous, two kinds of seeking refuge are remembered.

original: yadāvagacched āyatyām ādhikyaṃ dhruvam ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: yadā avagacchet āyatyām ādhikyam dhruvam ātmanaḥ
translated: When one understands that in the future one's own prosperity is certain,

original: tadātve cālpikāṃ pīḍāṃ tadā saṃdhiṃ samāśrayet // / //
analyzed: tadātve ca alpikām pīḍām tadā saṃdhim samāśrayet
translated: And also the present slight hardship, then one should resort to peace.

original: yadā prahṛṣṭā manyeta sarvās tu prakṛtīr bhṛśam /
analyzed: yadā prahṛṣṭāḥ manyeta sarvāḥ tu prakṛtīḥ bhṛśam
translated: When one thinks that all the elements are extremely delighted,

original: atyucchritaṃ tathātmānaṃ tadā kurvīta vigraham // / //
analyzed: ati ucchritam tathā ātmānam tadā kurvīta vigraham
translated: And one's own self is very exalted, then one should make war.

original: yadā manyeta bhāvena hṛṣṭaṃ puṣṭaṃ balaṃ svakam /
analyzed: yadā manyeta bhāvena hṛṣṭam puṣṭam balam svakam
translated: When one thinks that one's own army is delighted and nourished in spirit,

original: parasya viparītaṃ ca tadā yāyād ripuṃ prati // / //
analyzed: parasya viparītam ca tadā yāyāt ripum prati
translated: And that of the enemy is the opposite, then one should march against the enemy.

original: yadā tu syāt parikṣīṇo vāhanena balena ca /
analyzed: yadā tu syāt parikṣīṇaḥ vāhanena balena ca
translated: But when one's own army is exhausted in terms of mounts and forces,

original: tadāsīta prayatnena śanakaiḥ sāntvayann arīn // / //
analyzed: tadā āsīta prayatnena śanakais sāntvayan arīn
translated: Then he should sit down and slowly appease the enemies with effort.

original: manyetāriṃ yadā rājā sarvathā balavattaram /
analyzed: manyeta arim yadā rājā sarvathā balavattaram
translated: When the king considers the enemy to be stronger in every way,

original: tadā dvidhā balaṃ kṛtvā sādhayet kāryam ātmanaḥ // / //
analyzed: tadā dvidhā balam kṛtvā sādhayet kāryam ātmanaḥ
translated: then he should divide his army into two parts and accomplish his own purpose.

original: yadā parabalānāṃ tu gamanīyatamo bhavet /
analyzed: yadā para balānām tu gamanīyatamaḥ bhavet
translated: When he becomes the most vulnerable of the enemy forces,

original: tadā tu saṃśrayet kṣipraṃ dhārmikaṃ balinaṃ nṛpam // / //
analyzed: tadā tu saṃśrayet kṣipram dhārmikam balinam nṛpam
translated: then he should quickly seek refuge with a righteous and powerful king.

original: nigrahaṃ prakṛtīnāṃ ca kuryād yo 'ribalasya ca /
analyzed: nigraham prakṛtīnām ca kuryāt yaḥ ri balasya ca
translated: He who punishes the subjects and the forces of the enemy,

original: upaseveta taṃ nityaṃ sarvayatnair guruṃ yathā // / //
analyzed: upaseveta tam nityam sarva yatnaiḥ gurum yathā
translated: should always serve him with all efforts, like a preceptor.

original: yadi tatrāpi saṃpaśyed doṣaṃ saṃśrayakāritam /
analyzed: yadi tatra api saṃpaśyet doṣam saṃśraya kāritam
translated: If he sees even there a fault arising from seeking refuge,

original: suyuddham eva tatrāpi nirviśaṅkaḥ samācaret // / //
analyzed: su yuddham eva tatra api nirviśaṅkaḥ samācaret
translated: then he should fearlessly engage in good warfare there.

original: sarvopāyais tathā kuryān nītijñaḥ pṛthivīpatiḥ /
analyzed: sarva upāyaiḥ tathā kuryāt nīti jñaḥ pṛthivīpatiḥ
translated: In the same way, the king who knows policy should employ all means

original: yathāsyābhyadhikā na syur mitrodāsīnaśatravaḥ // / //🔽āyatiṃ sarvakāryāṇāṃ tadātvaṃ ca vicārayet /🔽atītānāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ guṇadoṣau ca tattvataḥ // / //
analyzed: yathā asya abhyadhikāḥ na syuḥ mitra udāsīna śatravaḥ  āyatim sarva kāryāṇām tadātvam ca vicārayet  atītānām ca sarveṣām guṇa doṣau ca tattvataḥ
translated: so that his friends, neutrals, and enemies do not surpass him.🔽He should consider the future and the present of all actions,🔽and the virtues and faults of all past events truthfully.

original: āyatyāṃ guṇadoṣajñas tadātve kṣipraniścayaḥ /
analyzed: āyatyām guṇa doṣa jñaḥ tadātve kṣipra niścayaḥ
translated: One who knows the virtues and faults of the future, and who makes quick decisions in the present,

original: atīte kāryaśeṣajñaḥ śatrubhir nābhibhūyate // / //
analyzed: atīte kārya śeṣa jñaḥ śatrubhiḥ na abhibhūyate
translated: Knowing the remainder of past actions, he is not overcome by enemies.

original: yathainaṃ nābhisaṃdadhyur mitrodāsīnaśatravaḥ /
analyzed: yathā enam na abhisaṃdadhyuḥ mitra udāsīna śatravaḥ
translated: So that friends, neutrals, and enemies do not attack him,

original: tathā sarvaṃ saṃvidadhyād eṣa sāmāsiko nayaḥ // / //
analyzed: tathā sarvam saṃvidadhyāt eṣa sāmāsikaḥ nayaḥ
translated: he should arrange everything in this way. This is the general policy.

original: tadā tu yānam ātiṣṭhed arirāṣṭraṃ prati prabhuḥ /
analyzed: tadā tu yānam ātiṣṭhet ari rāṣṭram prati prabhuḥ
translated: Then the lord should undertake a campaign against the enemy's kingdom.

original: tadānena vidhānena yāyād aripuraṃ śanaiḥ // / //
analyzed: tadā anena vidhānena yāyāt ari puram śanais
translated: Then he should slowly march towards the enemy's city in this manner.

original: mārgaśīrṣe śubhe māsi yāyād yātrāṃ mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: mārgaśīrṣe śubhe māsi yāyāt yātrām mahīpatiḥ
translated: In the auspicious month of Margashirsha, the king should undertake a campaign.

original: phālgunaṃ vātha caitraṃ vā māsau prati yathābalam // / //
analyzed: phālgunam vā atha caitram vā māsau prati yathābalam
translated: Or in the months of Phalguna or Chaitra, according to his strength.

original: anyeṣv api tu kāleṣu yadā paśyed dhruvaṃ jayam /
analyzed: anyeṣu api tu kāleṣu yadā paśyet dhruvam jayam
translated: But even at other times, when he sees certain victory,

original: tadā yāyād vigṛhyaiva vyasane cotthite ripoḥ // / //🔽kṛtvā vidhānaṃ mūle tu yātrikaṃ ca yathāvidhi /
analyzed: tadā yāyāt vigṛhya eva vyasane ca utthite ripoḥ  kṛtvā vidhānam mūle tu yātrikam ca yathāvidhi
translated: then he should march forth, even if he is in a calamity caused by the enemy.🔽Having made arrangements at home and the campaign according to proper procedure,

original: upagṛhyāspadaṃ caiva cārān samyag vidhāya ca // / //
analyzed: upagṛhya āspadam ca eva cārān samyak vidhāya ca
translated: having secured a base and properly deploying spies,

original: saṃśodhya trividhaṃ mārgaṃ ṣaḍvidhaṃ ca balaṃ svakam /
analyzed: saṃśodhya trividham mārgam ṣaḍvidham ca balam svakam
translated: having cleared the three types of roads and his own sixfold army,

original: sāṃparāyikakalpena yāyād aripuraṃ prati // / //
analyzed: sāṃparāyika kalpena yāyāt ari puram prati
translated: he should march towards the enemy's city with a view to the next world.

original: śatrusevini mitre ca gūḍhe yuktataro bhavet /
analyzed: śatru sevini mitre ca gūḍhe yuktataraḥ bhavet
translated: He should be more cautious towards a friend who serves the enemy and who is hidden.

original: gatapratyāgate caiva sa hi kaṣṭataro ripuḥ // / //
analyzed: gata pratyāgate ca eva sa hi kaṣṭataraḥ ripuḥ
translated: For such an enemy is more difficult to deal with than one who has gone away or returned.

original: daṇḍavyūhena tan mārgaṃ yāyāt tu śakaṭena vā /
analyzed: daṇḍa vyūhena tat mārgam yāyāt tu śakaṭena vā
translated: One should proceed along that path with the Danda Vyuha, or with the Shakata Vyuha,

original: varāhamakarābhyāṃ vā sūcyā vā garuḍena vā // / //
analyzed: varāha makarābhyām vā sūcyā vā garuḍena vā
translated: Or with the Varaha or Makara Vyuhas, or with the Suchi or Garuda Vyuhas.

original: yataś ca bhayam āśaṅket tato vistārayed balam /
analyzed: yatas ca bhayam āśaṅket tatas vistārayet balam
translated: And from wherever danger is suspected, one should extend one's forces.

original: padmena caiva vyūhena niviśeta sadā svayam // / //
analyzed: padmena ca eva vyūhena niviśeta sadā svayam
translated: And one should always encamp oneself with the Padma Vyuha.

original: senāpatibalādhyakṣau sarvadikṣu niveśayet /
analyzed: senāpati balādhyakṣau sarva dikṣu niveśayet
translated: One should station the commander and the chief of the forces in all directions.

original: yataś ca bhayam āśaṅket prācīṃ tāṃ kalpayed diśam // / //
analyzed: yatas ca bhayam āśaṅket prācīm tām kalpayet diśam
translated: And from wherever danger is suspected, one should consider that the eastern direction.

original: gulmāṃś ca sthāpayed āptān kṛtasaṃjñān samantataḥ /
analyzed: gulmān ca sthāpayet āptān kṛta saṃjñān samantataḥ
translated: And one should station reliable troops in all directions, who are familiar with the signals,

original: sthāne yuddhe ca kuśalān abhīrūn avikāriṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: sthāne yuddhe ca kuśalān abhīrūn avikāriṇaḥ
translated: Skilled in standing and fighting, fearless, and unchanging.

original: saṃhatān yodhayed alpān kāmaṃ vistārayed bahūn /
analyzed: saṃhatān yodhayet alpān kāmam vistārayet bahūn
translated: One should fight with a small number in close formation, but one may extend a large number as one wishes.

original: sūcyā vajreṇa caivaitān vyūhena vyūhya yodhayet // / //
analyzed: sūcyā vajreṇa ca eva etān vyūhena vyūhya yodhayet
translated: One should fight them, having arrayed them in the Suchi or Vajra Vyuhas.

original: syandanāśvaiḥ same yudhyed anūpe nau dvipais tathā /
analyzed: syandana aśvaiḥ same yudhyet anūpe nau dvipaiḥ tathā
translated: One should fight on even ground with chariots and horses, and in marshy areas with boats and elephants,

original: vṛkṣagulmāvṛte cāpair asicarmāyudhaiḥ sthale // / //
analyzed: vṛkṣa gulma āvṛte cāpaiḥ asi carma āyudhaiḥ sthale
translated: And in places covered with trees and bushes with bows, swords, and shields.

original: kurukṣetrāṃś ca matsyāṃś ca pañcālāñ śūrasenajān /
analyzed: kurukṣetrān ca matsyān ca pañcālām śūrasena jān
translated: The Kurus, the Matsyas, the Panchalas, and the Shurasenas,

original: dīrghāṃl laghūṃś caiva narān agrānīkeṣu yojayet // / //
analyzed: dīrghān laghūn ca eva narān agra anīkeṣu yojayet
translated: He should employ men who are tall and short in the van of the army.

original: praharṣayed balaṃ vyūhya tāṃś ca samyak parīkṣayet /
analyzed: praharṣayet balam vyūhya tān ca samyak parīkṣayet
translated: Having arrayed the army, he should gladden it and thoroughly examine it.

original: ceṣṭāś caiva vijānīyād arīn yodhayatām api // / //🔽uparudhyārim āsīta rāṣṭraṃ cāsyopapīḍayet /
analyzed: ceṣṭāḥ ca eva vijānīyāt arīn yodhayatām api  uparudhya arim āsīta rāṣṭram ca asya upapīḍayet
translated: He should also know the movements of those who are fighting with the enemy.🔽Having hemmed in the enemy, he should remain (there) and afflict his kingdom.

original: dūṣayec cāsya satataṃ yavasānnodakendhanam // / //
analyzed: dūṣayet ca asya satatam yavasa anna udaka indhanam
