original: samas tatra vibhāgaḥ syāj jyeṣṭhatā nāsti hi striyāḥ // / //
analyzed: samaḥ tatra vibhāgaḥ syāt jyeṣṭha tā na asti hi striyāḥ
translated: there the division should be equal, for a woman has no seniority.

original: aputrāyāṃ mṛtāyāṃ tu putrikāyāṃ kathaṃ cana /
analyzed: aputrāyām mṛtāyām tu putrikāyām katham cana
translated: But if a daughter appointed as a son dies without issue,

original: dhanaṃ tat putrikābhartā haretaivāvicārayan // / //
analyzed: dhanam tat putrikā bhartā hareta eva a vicārayan
translated: the husband of that daughter should take the property without hesitation.

original: akṛtā vā kṛtā vāpi yaṃ vindet sadṛśāt sutam /
analyzed: a kṛtā vā kṛtā vā api yam vindet sadṛśāt sutam
translated: Whether she is appointed or not, if she obtains a son from a suitable person,

original: pautrī mātāmahas tena dadyāt piṇḍaṃ hared dhanam // / //
analyzed: pautrī mātāmahaḥ tena dadyāt piṇḍam haret dhanam
translated: by that grandson the maternal grandfather should offer the piṇḍa and take the property.

original: putreṇa lokāñ jayati pautreṇānantyam aśnute /
analyzed: putreṇa lokān jayati pautreṇa ānantyam aśnute
translated: By a son one conquers the worlds, by a grandson one attains immortality,

original: atha putrasya pautreṇa bradhnasyāpnoti viṣṭapam // / //
analyzed: atha putrasya pautreṇa bradhnasya āpnoti viṣṭapam
translated: and then by the son's grandson one attains the highest heaven.

original: puṃnāmno narakād yasmāt trāyate pitaraṃ sutaḥ /
analyzed: puṃnāmnaḥ narakāt yasmāt trāyate pitaram sutaḥ
translated: Because a son saves the father from the hell called Put,

original: tasmāt putra iti proktaḥ svayam eva svayaṃbhuvā // / //
analyzed: tasmāt putraḥ iti proktaḥ svayam eva svayaṃbhuvā
translated: therefore he is called a son by the Self-Existent One himself.

original: pautradauhitrayor loke viśeṣo nopapadyate /
analyzed: pautra dauhitrayoḥ loke viśeṣaḥ na upapadyate
translated: Between a grandson and a daughter's son, there is no difference in the world.

original: dauhitro 'pi hy amutrainaṃ saṃtārayati pautravat // / //
analyzed: dauhitraḥ pi hi amutra enam saṃtārayati pautra vat
translated: For a daughter's son also delivers him in the next world, just like a grandson.

original: mātuḥ prathamataḥ piṇḍaṃ nirvapet putrikāsutaḥ /
analyzed: mātuḥ prathamatas piṇḍam nirvapet putrikā sutaḥ
translated: The son of a daughter should first offer the funeral cake to his mother,

original: dvitīyaṃ tu pitus tasyās tṛtīyaṃ tatpituḥ pituḥ // / //
analyzed: dvitīyam tu pituḥ tasyāḥ tṛtīyam tad pituḥ pituḥ
translated: secondly to her father, and thirdly to his grandfather.

original: upapanno guṇaiḥ sarvaiḥ putro yasya tu dattrimaḥ /
analyzed: upapannaḥ guṇaiḥ sarvaiḥ putraḥ yasya tu dattrimaḥ
translated: But if a son adopted by a man possesses all the qualities,

original: sa haretaiva tadrikthaṃ saṃprāpto 'py anyagotrataḥ // / //🔽gotrarikthe janayitur na hared dattrimaḥ kva cit /
analyzed: sa hareta eva tad riktham saṃprāptaḥ u pi anya gotrataḥ  gotra rikthe janayituḥ na haret dattrimaḥ kva cit
translated: he alone shall inherit his wealth, even if he comes from another family.🔽A son adopted by another person shall not inherit the family and property of his (natural) father.

original: gotrarikthānugaḥ piṇḍo vyapaiti dadataḥ svadhā // / //
analyzed: gotra riktha anugaḥ piṇḍaḥ vyapaiti dadataḥ svadhā
translated: The funeral cake follows the family and property; it perishes if given to one not of the family.

original: aniyuktāsutaś caiva putriṇyāptaś ca devarāt /
analyzed: a niyukta a sutaḥ ca eva putriṇī āptaḥ ca devarāt
translated: And the son of an unmarried woman, and one obtained from the brother-in-law by the widow,

original: ubhau tau nārhato bhāgaṃ jārajātakakāmajau // / //🔽niyuktāyām api pumān nāryāṃ jāto 'vidhānataḥ /
analyzed: ubhau tau na arhataḥ bhāgam jāra jātaka kāma jau  niyuktāyām api pumān nāryām jātaḥ vidhānataḥ
translated: both of them do not deserve a share; they are born of lust, the son of an adulteress.🔽Even if born from a woman appointed (by the husband), a man born without (the husband's) sanction,

original: naivārhaḥ paitṛkaṃ rikthaṃ patitotpādito hi saḥ // / //🔽haret tatra niyuktāyāṃ jātaḥ putro yathāurasaḥ /
analyzed: na eva arhaḥ paitṛkam riktham patita utpāditaḥ hi saḥ  haret tatra niyuktāyām jātaḥ putraḥ yathā aurasaḥ
translated: does not deserve the paternal property, for he is begotten by a fallen (man).🔽There, a son born of a woman appointed (by the husband) shall inherit like a son born of his own loins.

original: kṣetrikasya tu tad bījaṃ dharmataḥ prasavaś ca saḥ // / //
analyzed: kṣetrikasya tu tat bījam dharmataḥ prasavaḥ ca saḥ
translated: But the seed belongs to the owner of the field; the offspring belongs to him according to the law.

original: dhanaṃ yo bibhṛyād bhrātur mṛtasya striyam eva ca /
analyzed: dhanam yaḥ bibhṛyāt bhrātuḥ mṛtasya striyam eva ca
translated: He who maintains the wealth and the wife of a deceased brother,

original: so 'patyaṃ bhrātur utpādya dadyāt tasyaiva taddhanam // / //🔽yā niyuktānyataḥ putraṃ devarād vāpy avāpnuyāt /
analyzed: saḥ u patyam bhrātuḥ utpādya dadyāt tasya eva tat dhanam  yā niyuktā anyatas putram devarāt vā api avāpnuyāt
translated: he should beget a son for his brother and give that wealth to him.🔽If a woman appointed (to bear a child) obtains a son from her brother-in-law or from another,

original: taṃ kāmajam arikthīyaṃ vṛthotpannaṃ pracakṣate // / //
analyzed: tam kāma jam arikthīyam vṛthotpannam pracakṣate
translated: that son born of lust they declare to be an illegitimate son, born in vain.

original: etad vidhānaṃ vijñeyaṃ vibhāgasyaikayoniṣu /
analyzed: etat vidhānam vijñeyam vibhāgasya eka yoniṣu
translated: This rule should be known regarding the division among those of the same womb.

original: bahvīṣu caikajātānāṃ nānāstrīṣu nibodhata // / //
analyzed: bahvīṣu ca ekajātānām nānā strīṣu nibodhata
translated: Listen now to (the rule regarding) the division among many sons born of different wives.

original: brāhmaṇasyānupūrvyeṇa catasras tu yadi striyaḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇasya ānupūrvyeṇa catasraḥ tu yadi striyaḥ
translated: If a Brahmana has four wives in the regular order,

original: tāsāṃ putreṣu jāteṣu vibhāge 'yaṃ vidhiḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: tāsām putreṣu jāteṣu vibhāge yam vidhiḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: this is the rule declared for the division among the sons born of them.

original: kīnāśo govṛṣo yānam alaṅkāraś ca veśma ca /
analyzed: kīnāśaḥ go vṛṣaḥ yānam alaṅkāraḥ ca veśma ca
translated: The plough, the bull, the conveyance, the ornaments, and the house,

original: viprasyāuddhārikaṃ deyam ekāṃśaś ca pradhānataḥ // / //
analyzed: viprasya āuddhārikam deyam eka aṃśaḥ ca pradhānataḥ
translated: should be given as the additional share to the Brahmana, and one principal share.

original: tryaṃśaṃ dāyād dhared vipro dvāv aṃśau kṣatriyāsutaḥ /
analyzed: tri aṃśam dāyāt dharet vipraḥ dvau aṃśau kṣatriyā sutaḥ
translated: The Brahmana son shall take three shares, the son of the Kshatriya mother two shares,

original: vaiśyājaḥ sārdham evāṃśam aṃśaṃ śūdrāsuto haret // / //
analyzed: vaiśyā jaḥ sārdham eva aṃśam aṃśam śūdrā sutaḥ haret
translated: the son of the Vaishya mother one and a half shares, and the son of the Shudra mother one share.

original: sarvaṃ vā rikthajātaṃ tad daśadhā parikalpya ca /
analyzed: sarvam vā rikthajātam tat daśadhā parikalpya ca
translated: Or having divided all that property into ten parts,

original: dharmyaṃ vibhāgaṃ kurvīta vidhinānena dharmavit // / //
analyzed: dharmyam vibhāgam kurvīta vidhinā anena dharma vid
translated: The man who knows the law should make a just division according to this rule.

original: caturo 'ṃśān hared vipras trīn aṃśān kṣatriyāsutaḥ /
analyzed: caturaḥ ṃśān haret vipraḥ trīn aṃśān kṣatriyā sutaḥ
translated: The Brâhmana shall take four shares, the son of the Kshatriya mother three shares,

original: vaiśyāputro hared dvyaṃśaṃ aṃśaṃ śūdrāsuto haret // / //
analyzed: vaiśyā putraḥ haret dvi aṃśam aṃśam śūdrā sutaḥ haret
translated: The son of the Vaisya mother two shares, and the son of the Sûdra mother one share.

original: yady api syāt tu satputro 'py asatputro 'pi vā bhavet /
analyzed: yadi api syāt tu vā bhavet
translated: Even if he has good sons, or even if he has no good sons,

original: nādhikaṃ daśamād dadyāc chūdrāputrāya dharmataḥ // / //
analyzed: na adhikam daśamāt dadyāt śūdrā putrāya dharmataḥ
translated: The son of the Sûdra wife shall not, according to the law, receive more than a tenth part.

original: brāhmaṇakṣatriyaviśāṃ śūdrāputro na rikthabhāk /
analyzed: brāhmaṇa kṣatriya viśām śūdrā putraḥ na riktha bhāj
translated: The son of a Sûdra wife is not entitled to a share of the estate of a Brâhmana, Kshatriya, or Vaisya.

original: yad evāsya pitā dadyāt tad evāsya dhanaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: yat eva asya pitā dadyāt tat eva asya dhanam bhavet
translated: Whatever his father may give him, that shall be his property.

original: samavarṇāsu vā jātāḥ sarve putrā dvijanmanām /
analyzed: sama varṇāsu vā jātāḥ sarve putrāḥ dvijanmanām
translated: Or all the sons of twice-born men, born of wives of the same caste,

original: uddhāraṃ jyāyase dattvā bhajerann itare samam // / //
analyzed: uddhāram jyāyase dattvā bhajeran itare samam
translated: shall, after the eldest has taken his share, divide the estate equally.

original: śūdrasya tu savarṇaiva nānyā bhāryā vidhīyate /
analyzed: śūdrasya tu savarṇā eva na anyā bhāryā vidhīyate
translated: But for a Sûdra only a wife of the same caste is ordained, and no other;

original: tasyāṃ jātāḥ samāṃśāḥ syur yadi putraśataṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: tasyām jātāḥ samāṃśāḥ syuḥ yadi putra śatam bhavet
translated: and if he has a hundred sons, they shall all share alike.

original: putrān dvādaśa yān āha nṝṇāṃ svāyaṃbhuvo manuḥ /
analyzed: putrān dvādaśa yān āha nṝṇām svāyaṃbhuvaḥ manuḥ
translated: Manu, the son of the Self-existent (Svayambhu), has declared twelve kinds of sons who are heirs to a share of the estate of him who has no (legitimate) son.

original: teṣāṃ ṣaḍ bandhudāyādāḥ ṣaḍ adāyādabāndhavāḥ // / //
analyzed: teṣām ṣaṭ bandhu dāyādāḥ ṣaṭ a dāyāda bāndhavāḥ
translated: Of these, six are heirs and relatives, and six are relatives only, and not heirs.

original: aurasaḥ kṣetrajaś caiva dattaḥ kṛtrima eva ca /🔽gūḍhotpanno 'paviddhaś ca dāyādā bāndhavāś ca ṣaṭ // / //
analyzed: aurasaḥ kṣetrajaḥ ca eva dattaḥ kṛtrimaḥ eva ca  gūḍha utpanna upaviddhaḥ ca dāyādāḥ bāndhavāḥ ca ṣaṭ
translated: The body-born son, the son of an appointed daughter, the adopted son, the son made by pouring libations,

original: kānīnaś ca sahoḍhaś ca krītaḥ paunarbhavas tathā /
analyzed: kānīnaḥ ca sahoḍhaḥ ca krītaḥ paunarbhavaḥ tathā
translated: The son secretly born, and the son cast out—these six are both heirs and relatives.🔽The son of a remarried woman, the son bought, the son given in adoption, the son begotten on the wife,

original: svayaṃdattaś ca śaudraś ca ṣaḍ adāyādabāndhavāḥ // / //
analyzed: svayaṃdattaḥ ca śaudraḥ ca ṣaṭ a dāyāda bāndhavāḥ
translated: The son self-given, and the son of a Shudra wife—these six are neither heirs nor relatives.

original: yādṛśaṃ phalam āpnoti kuplavaiḥ saṃtarañ jalam /
analyzed: yādṛśam phalam āpnoti ku plavaiḥ saṃtaram jalam
translated: Just as one obtains fruit by crossing water with a bad raft,

original: tādṛśaṃ phalam āpnoti kuputraiḥ saṃtaraṃs tamaḥ // / //
analyzed: tādṛśam phalam āpnoti ku putraiḥ saṃtaran tamaḥ
translated: Just so one obtains fruit by crossing darkness with bad sons.

original: yady ekarikthinau syātām aurasakṣetrajau sutau /
analyzed: yadi ekarikthinau syātām aurasa kṣetrajau sutau
translated: If there are two sons, one body-born and one son of an appointed daughter, who inherit the same property,

original: yasya yat paitṛkaṃ rikthaṃ sa tad gṛhṇīta netaraḥ // / //
analyzed: yasya yat paitṛkam riktham sa tat gṛhṇīta na itaraḥ
translated: Each shall take what belongs to him, and not the other.

original: eka evāurasaḥ putraḥ pitryasya vasunaḥ prabhuḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ eva aurasaḥ putraḥ pitryasya vasunaḥ prabhuḥ
translated: The body-born son alone is the master of the paternal property.

original: śeṣāṇām ānṛśaṃsyārthaṃ pradadyāt tu prajīvanam // / //
analyzed: śeṣāṇām ānṛśaṃsya artham pradadyāt tu prajīvanam
translated: But for the sake of compassion, he should give a livelihood to the others.

original: ṣaṣṭhaṃ tu kṣetrajasyāṃśaṃ pradadyāt paitṛkād dhanāt /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭham tu kṣetrajasya aṃśam pradadyāt paitṛkāt dhanāt
translated: But he should give one-sixth of the paternal property to the son of an appointed daughter.

original: auraso vibhajan dāyaṃ pitryaṃ pañcamam eva vā // / //
analyzed: aurasaḥ vibhajan dāyam pitryam pañcamam eva vā
translated: The body-born son, when dividing the paternal property, should take one-fifth.

original: aurasakṣetrajau putrau pitṛrikthasya bhāginau /
analyzed: aurasa kṣetrajau putrau pitṛ rikthasya bhāginau
translated: The body-born son and the son of an appointed daughter are the heirs of the paternal property.

original: daśāpare tu kramaśo gotrarikthāṃśabhāginaḥ // / //🔽svakṣetre saṃskṛtāyāṃ tu svayam utpādayed dhi yam /
analyzed: daśa apare tu kramaśas gotra riktha aṃśa bhāginaḥ  sva kṣetre saṃskṛtāyām tu svayam utpādayet hi yam
translated: But the other ten, in order, are entitled to the property of their gotra.

original: tam aurasaṃ vijānīyāt putraṃ prāthamakalpikam // / //
analyzed: tam aurasam vijānīyāt putram prāthamakalpikam
translated: One should know that the son whom one begets oneself on a wife of the same caste is the first-class son, called aurasa.

original: yas talpajaḥ pramītasya klībasya vyādhitasya vā /
analyzed: yaḥ talpa jaḥ pramītasya klībasya vyādhitasya vā
translated: The son born of a dead man, or of a eunuch, or of a sick man, in his own bed,

original: svadharmeṇa niyuktāyāṃ sa putraḥ kṣetrajaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: svadharmeṇa niyuktāyām sa putraḥ kṣetrajaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: is known as the kshetraja son, begotten by another on a wife appointed by one's own self.

original: mātā pitā vā dadyātāṃ yam adbhiḥ putram āpadi /
analyzed: mātā pitā vā dadyātām yam adbhiḥ putram āpadi
translated: The son whom the mother or the father gives in a time of distress,

original: sadṛśaṃ prītisaṃyuktaṃ sa jñeyo dattrimaḥ sutaḥ // / //🔽sadṛśaṃ tu prakuryād yaṃ guṇadoṣavicakṣaṇam /
analyzed: sadṛśam prīti saṃyuktam sa jñeyaḥ dattrimaḥ sutaḥ  sadṛśam tu prakuryāt yam guṇa doṣa vicakṣaṇam
translated: with affection, should be known as the adopted son.🔽The son whom one makes oneself, who is wise in judging the merits and demerits,

original: putraṃ putraguṇair yuktaṃ sa vijñeyaś ca kṛtrimaḥ // / //
analyzed: putram putra guṇaiḥ yuktam sa vijñeyaḥ ca kṛtrimaḥ
translated: and who is endowed with the qualities of a son, should be known as the artificial son.

original: utpadyate gṛhe yas tu na ca jñāyeta kasya saḥ /
analyzed: utpadyate gṛhe yaḥ tu na ca jñāyeta kasya saḥ
translated: The son who is born in the house but whose father is not known,

original: sa gṛhe gūḍha utpannas tasya syād yasya talpajaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa gṛhe gūḍhaḥ utpannaḥ tasya syāt yasya talpajaḥ
translated: he should belong to him from whose seed he is born.

original: mātāpitṛbhyām utsṛṣṭaṃ tayor anyatareṇa vā /
analyzed: mātā pitṛbhyām utsṛṣṭam tayoḥ anyatareṇa vā
translated: The son whom the parents abandon, or one of them,

original: yaṃ putraṃ parigṛhṇīyād apaviddhaḥ sa ucyate // / //
analyzed: yam putram parigṛhṇīyāt apaviddhaḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: whom one adopts, is called the abandoned son.

original: pitṛveśmani kanyā tu yaṃ putraṃ janayed rahaḥ /
analyzed: pitṛ veśmani kanyā tu yam putram janayet rahaḥ
translated: The daughter who gives birth to a son secretly in her father's house,

original: taṃ kānīnaṃ vaden nāmnā voḍhuḥ kanyāsamudbhavam // / //
analyzed: tam kānīnam vadet nāmnā voḍhuḥ kanyā samudbhavam
translated: That son born of the wife married by the maiden's younger brother should be called by the name of the husband of the maiden.

original: yā garbhiṇī saṃskriyate jñātājñātāpi vā satī /
analyzed: yā garbhiṇī saṃskriyate jñāta a jñātā api vā satī
translated: If a pregnant woman is consecrated, whether the pregnancy is known or unknown,

original: voḍhuḥ sa garbho bhavati sahoḍha iti cocyate // / //
analyzed: voḍhuḥ sa garbhaḥ bhavati sahoḍhaḥ iti ca ucyate
translated: that embryo belongs to the husband. He is called a sahoḍha (conceived together).

original: krīṇīyād yas tv apatyārthaṃ mātāpitror yam antikāt /
analyzed: krīṇīyāt yaḥ tu apatya artham mātā pitroḥ yam antikāt
translated: He who buys a son for the sake of progeny from the parents,

original: sa krītakaḥ sutas tasya sadṛśo 'sadṛśo 'pi vā // / //
analyzed: sa krītakaḥ sutaḥ tasya vā
translated: whether similar or dissimilar, that bought son belongs to him.

original: yā patyā vā parityaktā vidhavā vā svayecchayā /
analyzed: yā patyā vā parityaktā vidhavā vā svayā icchayā
translated: She who is abandoned by her husband or is a widow by her own will,

original: utpādayet punar bhūtvā sa paunarbhava ucyate // / //
analyzed: utpādayet punar bhūtvā sa paunarbhavaḥ ucyate
translated: and begets (another son) after becoming (a widow), is called a paunarbhava (one who has another birth).

original: sā ced akṣatayoniḥ syād gatapratyāgatāpi vā /
analyzed: sā ced akṣatayoniḥ syāt gata pratyāgatā api vā
translated: If she is of an intact womb, or has gone away and returned,

original: paunarbhavena bhartrā sā punaḥ saṃskāram arhati // / //
analyzed: paunarbhavena bhartrā sā punar saṃskāram arhati
translated: she deserves to be consecrated again by the paunarbhava husband.

original: mātāpitṛvihīno yas tyakto vā syād akāraṇāt /
analyzed: mātā pitṛ vihīnaḥ yaḥ tyaktaḥ vā syāt akāraṇāt
translated: He who is orphaned or abandoned without cause,

original: ātmānam arpayed yasmai svayaṃdattas tu sa smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: ātmānam arpayet yasmai svayaṃdattaḥ tu sa smṛtaḥ
translated: and offers himself to someone, is known as a svayandatta (self-given).

original: yaṃ brāhmaṇas tu śūdrāyāṃ kāmād utpādayet sutam /
analyzed: yam brāhmaṇaḥ tu śūdrāyām kāmāt utpādayet sutam
translated: The son whom a Brahmin begets out of lust on a Shudra woman,

original: sa pārayann eva śavas tasmāt pāraśavaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa pārayan eva śavaḥ tasmāt pāraśavaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: while carrying (his father), is a corpse; therefore he is known as a parashva (corpse-child).

original: dāsyāṃ vā dāsadāsyāṃ vā yaḥ śūdrasya suto bhavet /
analyzed: dāsyām vā dāsa dāsyām vā yaḥ śūdrasya sutaḥ bhavet
translated: He who is the son of a Shudra born from a slave woman or a slave's wife,

original: so 'nujñāto hared aṃśam iti dharmo vyavasthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: saḥ nujñātaḥ haret aṃśam iti dharmaḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: He, being permitted, should take a share; this is the settled rule of law.

original: kṣetrajādīn sutān etān ekādaśa yathoditān /
analyzed: kṣetraja ādīn sutān etān ekādaśa yathā uditān
translated: These eleven sons, beginning with the son of the soil, as mentioned,

original: putrapratinidhīn āhuḥ kriyālopān manīṣiṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: putra pratinidhīn āhuḥ kriyā lopāt manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: the wise declare to be substitutes for a son, in the absence of a son.

original: ya ete 'bhihitāḥ putrāḥ prasaṅgād anyabījajāḥ /
analyzed: ye ete bhihitāḥ putrāḥ prasaṅgāt anya bīja jāḥ
translated: These sons, begotten by another man, who have been mentioned in this connection,

original: yasya te bījato jātās tasya te netarasya tu // / //
analyzed: yasya te bījataḥ jātāḥ tasya te na itarasya tu
translated: belong to him from whose seed they are born, and not to any other.

original: bhrātṝṇām ekajātānām ekaś cet putravān bhavet /
analyzed: bhrātṝṇām ekajātānām ekaḥ ced putravān bhavet
translated: If one of the brothers born of the same mother has a son,

original: sarvāṃs tāṃs tena putreṇa putriṇo manur abravīt // / //
analyzed: sarvān tān tena putreṇa putriṇaḥ manuḥ abravīt
translated: Manu has declared all those brothers to be provided with sons through that son.

original: sarvāsām ekapatnīnām ekā cet putriṇī bhavet /
analyzed: sarvāsām ekapatnīnām ekā ced putriṇī bhavet
translated: If one of all the wives of one husband has a son,

original: sarvās tās tena putreṇa prāha putravatīr manuḥ // / //
analyzed: sarvāḥ tāḥ tena putreṇa prāha putravatīḥ manuḥ
translated: Manu declares all those wives to be provided with sons through that son.

original: śreyasaḥ śreyaso 'lābhe pāpīyān riktham arhati /
analyzed: śreyasaḥ śreyasaḥ lābhe pāpīyān riktham arhati
translated: If there is no acquisition of a better, the worse is entitled to inheritance.

original: bahavaś cet tu sadṛśāḥ sarve rikthasya bhāginaḥ // / //🔽na bhrātaro na pitaraḥ putrā rikthaharāḥ pituḥ /
analyzed: bahavaḥ ced tu sadṛśāḥ sarve rikthasya bhāginaḥ  na bhrātaraḥ na pitaraḥ putrāḥ riktha harāḥ pituḥ
translated: But if there are many who are equal, all of them are entitled to the inheritance.🔽Neither brothers nor fathers are heirs to the estate of a father who dies without a son.

original: pitā hared aputrasya rikthaṃ bhrātara eva ca // / //
analyzed: pitā haret aputrasya riktham bhrātaraḥ eva ca
translated: The father shall take the estate of a sonless man, and also his brothers.

original: trayāṇām udakaṃ kāryaṃ triṣu piṇḍaḥ pravartate /
analyzed: trayāṇām udakam kāryam triṣu piṇḍaḥ pravartate
translated: The water-offering to the three (ancestors) should be performed, and the ball-offering proceeds to the three.

original: caturthaḥ saṃpradātaiṣāṃ pañcamo nopapadyate // / //
analyzed: caturthaḥ saṃpradātā eṣām pañcamaḥ na upapadyate
translated: The fourth is the one who transmits them, the fifth is not applicable.

original: anantaraḥ sapiṇḍād yas tasya tasya dhanaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: anantaraḥ sapiṇḍāt yaḥ tasya tasya dhanam bhavet
translated: The next of kin, who is a sapinda, shall inherit the property of the one who has no heirs.

original: ata ūrdhvaṃ sakulyaḥ syād ācāryaḥ śiṣya eva vā // / //
analyzed: atas ūrdhvam sakulyaḥ syāt ācāryaḥ śiṣyaḥ eva vā
translated: After that, it shall be the agnate, the teacher, or the disciple.

original: sarveṣām apy abhāve tu brāhmaṇā rikthabhāginaḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣām api abhāve tu brāhmaṇāḥ riktha bhāginaḥ
translated: In the absence of all of them, the Brahmanas shall inherit the property.

original: traividyāḥ śucayo dāntās tathā dharmo na hīyate // / //
analyzed: traividyāḥ śucayaḥ dāntāḥ tathā dharmaḥ na hīyate
translated: The Brahmanas who are learned in the three Vedas, pure, and self-controlled - thus the Dharma does not suffer.

original: ahāryaṃ brāhmaṇadravyaṃ rājñā nityam iti sthitiḥ /
analyzed: ahāryam brāhmaṇa dravyam rājñā nityam iti sthitiḥ
translated: It is the settled rule that the property of a Brahmana shall never be taken by the king.

original: itareṣāṃ tu varṇānāṃ sarvābhāve haren nṛpaḥ // / //
analyzed: itareṣām tu varṇānām sarva abhāve haret nṛpaḥ
translated: But in the absence of all of them, the king shall take the property of the other Varnas.

original: saṃsthitasyānapatyasya sagotrāt putram āharet /
analyzed: saṃsthitasya anapatyasya sagotrāt putram āharet
translated: If a man dies without issue, the son of a co-wife shall take his property.

original: tatra yad rikthajātaṃ syāt tat tasmin pratipādayet // / //
analyzed: tatra yat rikthajātam syāt tat tasmin pratipādayet
translated: Whatever property there is, he shall hand it over to him.

original: dvau tu yau vivadeyātāṃ dvābhyāṃ jātau striyā dhane /
analyzed: dvau tu yau vivadeyātām dvābhyām jātau striyā dhane
translated: If two sons born of two different women dispute over the property of their mother,

original: tayor yad yasya pitryaṃ syāt tat sa gṛhṇīta netaraḥ // / //🔽jananyāṃ saṃsthitāyāṃ tu samaṃ sarve sahodarāḥ /
analyzed: tayoḥ yat yasya pitryam syāt tat sa gṛhṇīta na itaraḥ  jananyām saṃsthitāyām tu samam sarve sahodarāḥ
translated: each shall take what belongs to his father, not the other.🔽But when the mother has passed away, all the uterine brothers shall equally share

original: bhajeran mātṛkaṃ rikthaṃ bhaginyaś ca sanābhayaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhajeran mātṛkam riktham bhaginyaḥ ca sanābhayaḥ
translated: the property of their mother, as also the uterine sisters.

original: yās tāsāṃ syur duhitaras tāsām api yathārhataḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ tāsām syuḥ duhitaraḥ tāsām api yathārhataḥ
translated: And their daughters also shall receive their shares according to their respective shares.

original: mātāmahyā dhanāt kiṃ cit pradeyaṃ prītipūrvakam // / //
analyzed: mātāmahyāḥ dhanāt kim cit pradeyam prīti pūrvakam
translated: And something shall be given to them out of the wealth of the maternal grandmother, with affection.

original: adhyagnyadhyāvāhanikaṃ dattaṃ ca prītikarmaṇi /
analyzed: adhyagni adhyāvāhanikam dattam ca prīti karmaṇi
translated: What is given in the presence of fire, what is given in the absence of fire, what is given as a token of affection,

original: bhrātṛmātṛpitṛprāptaṃ ṣaḍvidhaṃ strīdhanaṃ smṛtam // / //
analyzed: bhrātṛ mātṛ pitṛ prāptam ṣaḍvidham strīdhanam smṛtam
translated: What is obtained from brothers, mother, and father - this sixfold property of a woman is known as strīdhana.

original: anvādheyaṃ ca yad dattaṃ patyā prītena caiva yat /
analyzed: anvādheyam ca yat dattam patyā prītena ca eva yat
translated: And what is given as an afterthought, and what is given by the husband out of affection,

original: patyau jīvati vṛttāyāḥ prajāyās tad dhanaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: patyau jīvati vṛttāyāḥ prajāyāḥ tat dhanam bhavet
translated: If the wife dies while the husband is alive, that property belongs to the children.

original: brāhmadaivārṣagāndharva prājāpatyeṣu yad vasu /
analyzed: brāhma daiva ārṣa gāndharva prājāpatyeṣu yat vasu
translated: The wealth obtained through the Brahma, Daiva, Arsha, Gandharva, and Prajapatya forms of marriage,

original: aprajāyām atītāyāṃ bhartur eva tad iṣyate // / //
analyzed: aprajāyām atītāyām bhartuḥ eva tat iṣyate
translated: If the wife dies without issue, it is considered to belong to the husband.

original: yat tv asyāḥ syād dhanaṃ dattaṃ vivāheṣv āsurādiṣu /
analyzed: yat tu asyāḥ syāt dhanam dattam vivāheṣu āsura ādiṣu
translated: But whatever wealth is given to her in the Asura and other forms of marriage,

original: aprajāyām atītāyāṃ mātāpitros tad iṣyate // / //
analyzed: aprajāyām atītāyām mātā pitroḥ tat iṣyate
translated: If the wife dies without issue, it is considered to belong to her mother and father.

original: striyāṃ tu yad bhaved vittaṃ pitrā dattaṃ kathaṃ cana /
analyzed: striyām tu yat bhavet vittam pitrā dattam katham cana
translated: Whatever wealth is somehow given to a woman by her father,

original: brāhmaṇī tad dharet kanyā tadapatyasya vā bhavet // / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇī tat dharet kanyā tad apatyasya vā bhavet
translated: The Brahmin woman shall take it, or it shall belong to her offspring.

original: na nirhāraṃ striyaḥ kuryuḥ kuṭumbād bahumadhyagāt /
analyzed: na nirhāram striyaḥ kuryuḥ kuṭumbāt bahu madhya gāt
translated: Women should not take away from the family anything of great value,

original: svakād api ca vittād dhi svasya bhartur anājñayā // / //
analyzed: svakāt api ca vittāt hi svasya bhartuḥ anājñayā
translated: Even from his own property, without the permission of his master.

original: patyau jīvati yaḥ strībhir alaṅkāro dhṛto bhavet /
analyzed: patyau jīvati yaḥ strībhiḥ alaṅkāraḥ dhṛtaḥ bhavet
translated: If any ornament is worn by women while the husband is alive,

original: na taṃ bhajeran dāyādā bhajamānāḥ patanti te // / //🔽anaṃśau klībapatitau jātyandhabadhirau tathā /
analyzed: na tam bhajeran dāyādāḥ bhajamānāḥ patanti te  an aṃśau klība patitau jātyandha badhirau tathā
translated: the co-parceners should not enjoy it; if they enjoy it, they fall.🔽A eunuch, an outcast, one congenitally blind or deaf,

original: unmattajaḍamūkāś ca ye ca ke cin nirindriyāḥ // / //🔽sarveṣām api tu nyāyyaṃ dātuṃ śaktyā manīṣiṇā /🔽grāsācchādanam atyantaṃ patito hy adadad bhavet // / //
analyzed: unmatta jaḍa mūkāḥ ca ye ca ke cit nirindriyāḥ  sarveṣām api tu nyāyyam dātum śaktyā manīṣiṇā  grāsa ācchādanam atyantam patitaḥ hi adadān bhavet
translated: an insane person, an idiot, a mute, and those who are devoid of any sense organ -🔽but it is proper for the wise to give them food and clothing to the best of his ability.🔽If a fallen person does not give them,

original: yady arthitā tu dāraiḥ syāt klībādīnāṃ kathaṃ cana /
analyzed: yadi arthi tā tu dāraiḥ syāt klība ādīnām katham cana
translated: if there is ever a request for a wife by eunuchs and others,

original: teṣām utpannatantūnām apatyaṃ dāyam arhati // / //
analyzed: teṣām utpanna tantūnām apatyam dāyam arhati
translated: the offspring of those whose threads have been created is entitled to inheritance.

original: yat kiṃ cit pitari prete dhanaṃ jyeṣṭho 'dhigacchati /
analyzed: yat kim cit pitari prete dhanam jyeṣṭhaḥ dhigacchati
translated: Whatever wealth the eldest son obtains after the father's death,

original: bhāgo yavīyasāṃ tatra yadi vidyānupālinaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhāgaḥ yavīyasām tatra yadi vidyā anupālinaḥ
translated: the younger brothers have a share in that, if they are maintaining their learning.

original: avidyānāṃ tu sarveṣāṃ īhātaś ced dhanaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: avidyānām tu sarveṣām īhātaḥ ced dhanam bhavet
translated: But if the wealth comes from their own efforts of those who are uneducated,

original: samas tatra vibhāgaḥ syād apitrya iti dhāraṇā // / //
analyzed: samaḥ tatra vibhāgaḥ syāt a pitrye iti dhāraṇā
translated: the division there should be equal, that is the accepted rule even without a father.

original: vidyādhanaṃ tu yady asya tat tasyaiva dhanaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: vidyā dhanam tu yadi asya tat tasya eva dhanam bhavet
translated: But if he has acquired wealth by his learning, that wealth belongs to him alone.

original: maitryam audvāhikaṃ caiva mādhuparkikam eva ca // / //
analyzed: maitryam audvāhikam ca eva mādhuparkikam eva ca
translated: The wealth acquired by friendly means, by marriage, and by the reception of guests,

original: bhrātṝṇāṃ yas tu neheta dhanaṃ śaktaḥ svakarmaṇā /
analyzed: bhrātṝṇām yaḥ tu na īheta dhanam śaktaḥ sva karmaṇā
translated: he who, being able, does not support his brothers by his own occupation,

original: sa nirbhājyaḥ svakād aṃśāt kiṃ cid dattvopajīvanam // / //🔽anupaghnan pitṛdravyaṃ śrameṇa yad upārjitam /
analyzed: sa nirbhājyaḥ svakāt aṃśāt kim cit dattvā upajīvanam  anupaghnan pitṛ dravyam śrameṇa yat upārjitam
translated: he should be excluded from the share, after giving him something for his maintenance.🔽What he has acquired by his own labour, without injuring the property of his father,

original: svayam īhitalabdhaṃ tan nākāmo dātum arhati // / //
analyzed: svayam īhita labdham tat na akāmaḥ dātum arhati
translated: he is not obliged to give to his brothers, if he does not wish it.

original: paitṛkaṃ tu pitā dravyam anavāptaṃ yad āpnuyāt /
analyzed: paitṛkam tu pitā dravyam an avāptam yat āpnuyāt
translated: But if the father should acquire property which belonged to his ancestors, and which had been lost,

original: na tat putrair bhajet sārdham akāmaḥ svayam arjitam // / //
analyzed: na tat putraiḥ bhajet sārdham akāmaḥ svayam arjitam
translated: he may not, if he does not wish it, share it with his sons, whom he has himself begotten.

original: vibhaktāḥ saha jīvanto vibhajeran punar yadi /
analyzed: vibhaktāḥ saha jīvantaḥ vibhajeran punar yadi
translated: If the brothers, who have been divided, live together again and again divide,

original: samas tatra vibhāgaḥ syāj jyaiṣṭhyaṃ tatra na vidyate // / //🔽yeṣāṃ jyeṣṭhaḥ kaniṣṭho vā hīyetāṃśapradānataḥ /
analyzed: samaḥ tatra vibhāgaḥ syāt jyaiṣṭhyam tatra na vidyate  yeṣām jyeṣṭhaḥ kaniṣṭhaḥ vā
translated: the division in that case shall be equal; there is no seniority in that case.🔽If the eldest or the youngest brother should be deprived of his share by selling or mortgaging through love of gambling, or if either of them should die,

original: mriyetānyataro vāpi tasya bhāgo na lupyate // / //
analyzed: mriyeta anyataraḥ vā api tasya bhāgaḥ na lupyate
translated: his share does not become lost.

original: sodaryā vibhajeraṃs taṃ sametya sahitāḥ samam /
analyzed: sodaryāḥ vibhajeran tam sametya sahitāḥ samam
translated: His uterine brothers, having met together, shall divide it equally among them.

original: bhrātaro ye ca saṃsṛṣṭā bhāginyaś ca sanābhayaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhrātaraḥ ye ca saṃsṛṣṭāḥ bhāginyaḥ ca sanābhayaḥ
translated: and brothers who have cohabited with the same woman, and uterine sisters.

original: yo jyeṣṭho vinikurvīta lobhād bhrātṝn yavīyasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ vinikurvīta lobhāt bhrātṝn yavīyasaḥ
translated: If the eldest brother, out of greed, ill-treats his younger brothers,

original: so 'jyeṣṭhaḥ syād abhāgaś ca niyantavyaś ca rājabhiḥ // / //
analyzed: saḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ syāt a bhāgaḥ ca niyantavyaḥ ca rājabhiḥ
translated: he shall cease to be the eldest, shall not receive the additional share, and shall be restrained by the king.

original: sarva eva vikarmasthā nārhanti bhrātaro dhanam /
analyzed: sarve eva vikarma sthāḥ na arhanti bhrātaraḥ dhanam
translated: All brothers who are engaged in improper occupations do not deserve a share in the property.

original: na cādattvā kaniṣṭhebhyo jyeṣṭhaḥ kurvīta yautakam // / //
analyzed: na ca a dattvā kaniṣṭhebhyaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ kurvīta yautakam
translated: And the eldest brother shall not appropriate the additional share without giving it to the younger brothers.

original: bhrātṝṇām avibhaktānāṃ yady utthānaṃ bhavet saha /
analyzed: bhrātṝṇām avibhaktānām yadi utthānam bhavet saha
translated: If the undivided brothers earn wealth jointly,

original: na putrabhāgaṃ viṣamaṃ pitā dadyāt kathaṃ cana // / //
analyzed: na putra bhāgam viṣamam pitā dadyāt katham cana
translated: the father shall by no means give unequal shares to the sons.

original: ūrdhvaṃ vibhāgāj jātas tu pitryam eva hared dhanam /
analyzed: ūrdhvam vibhāgāt jātaḥ tu pitryam eva haret dhanam
translated: But a son born after the division shall take the paternal property.

original: saṃsṛṣṭās tena vā ye syur vibhajeta sa taiḥ saha // / //
analyzed: saṃsṛṣṭāḥ tena vā ye syuḥ vibhajeta sa taiḥ saha
translated: Or those who have cohabited with him shall divide it with him.

original: anapatyasya putrasya mātā dāyam avāpnuyāt /
analyzed: anapatyasya putrasya mātā dāyam avāpnuyāt
translated: The mother shall receive the property of a son who dies without issue.

original: mātary api ca vṛttāyāṃ pitur mātā hared dhanam // / //
analyzed: mātari api ca vṛttāyām pituḥ mātā haret dhanam
translated: And if the mother also dies, the father's mother shall take the property.

original: ṛṇe dhane ca sarvasmin pravibhakte yathāvidhi /
analyzed: ṛṇe dhane ca sarvasmin pravibhakte yathāvidhi
translated: After the debt and the property have been duly divided,

original: paścād dṛśyeta yat kiṃ cit tat sarvaṃ samatāṃ nayet // / //
analyzed: paścāt dṛśyeta yat kim cit tat sarvam samatām nayet
translated: whatever else is seen, all that shall be equally divided.

original: vastraṃ patram alaṅkāraṃ kṛtānnam udakaṃ striyaḥ /
analyzed: vastram patram alaṅkāram kṛtānnam udakam striyaḥ
translated: Clothes, writing materials, ornaments, cooked food, water, and women,

original: yogakṣemaṃ pracāraṃ ca na vibhājyaṃ pracakṣate // / //🔽ayam ukto vibhāgo vaḥ putrāṇāṃ ca kriyāvidhiḥ /
analyzed: yogakṣemam pracāram ca na vibhājyam pracakṣate  ayam uktaḥ vibhāgaḥ vaḥ putrāṇām ca kriyā vidhiḥ
translated: and also the means of livelihood and the means of security are not to be divided.🔽Thus has been declared to you the division and the rules of conduct for the sons born of wives of the same and different castes.

original: kramaśaḥ kṣetrajādīnāṃ dyūtadharmaṃ nibodhata // / //
analyzed: kramaśas kṣetraja ādīnām dyūta dharmam nibodhata
translated: Now listen to the rules of gambling.

original: dyūtaṃ samāhvayaṃ caiva rājā rāṣṭrān nivārayet /
analyzed: dyūtam samāhvayam ca eva rājā rāṣṭrāt nivārayet
translated: The king should prohibit gambling and betting in his kingdom.

original: rājāntakaraṇāv etau dvau doṣau pṛthivīkṣitām // / //
analyzed: rāja anta karaṇau etau dvau doṣau pṛthivīkṣitām
translated: These two vices, gambling and betting, are the causes of the destruction of kingship.

original: prakāśam etat tāskaryaṃ yad devanasamāhvayau /
analyzed: prakāśam etat tāskaryam yat devana samāhvayau
translated: Gambling and betting are well-known forms of thievery.

original: tayor nityaṃ pratīghāte nṛpatir yatnavān bhavet // / //
analyzed: tayoḥ nityam pratīghāte nṛpatiḥ yatnavān bhavet
translated: The king should always be diligent in preventing them.

original: aprāṇibhir yat kriyate tal loke dyūtam ucyate /
analyzed: aprāṇibhiḥ yat kriyate tat loke dyūtam ucyate
translated: That which is done with non-living things is called gambling in the world.

original: prāṇibhiḥ kriyate yas tu sa vijñeyaḥ samāhvayaḥ // / //🔽dyūtaṃ samāhvayaṃ caiva yaḥ kuryāt kārayeta vā /
analyzed: prāṇibhiḥ kriyate yaḥ tu sa vijñeyaḥ samāhvayaḥ  dyūtam samāhvayam ca eva yaḥ kuryāt kārayeta vā
translated: But that which is done with living things should be known as betting.

original: tān sarvān ghātayed rājā śūdrāṃś ca dvijaliṅginaḥ // / //
analyzed: tān sarvān ghātayet rājā śūdrān ca dvijaliṅginaḥ
translated: The king should have all those who gamble or cause others to gamble executed, and also those Śūdras who assume the guise of twice-born men.

original: kitavān kuśīlavān krūrān pāṣaṇḍasthāṃś ca mānavān /
analyzed: kitavān kuśīlavān krūrān pāṣaṇḍa sthān ca mānavān
translated: Gamblers, cheats, cruel men, and those who follow heretical doctrines,

original: vikarmasthān śauṇḍikāṃś ca kṣipraṃ nirvāsayet purāt // / //
analyzed: vikarma sthān śauṇḍikān ca kṣipram nirvāsayet purāt
translated: And those engaged in improper occupations and wine-sellers, he should quickly banish from the city.

original: ete rāṣṭre vartamānā rājñaḥ prachannataskarāḥ /
analyzed: ete rāṣṭre vartamānāḥ rājñaḥ prachanna taskarāḥ
translated: These, while living in the kingdom, are the king's secret thieves.

original: vikarmakriyayā nityaṃ bādhante bhadrikāḥ prajāḥ // / //
analyzed: vikarma kriyayā nityam bādhante bhadrikāḥ prajāḥ
translated: They always oppress the good people by their improper actions.

original: dyūtam etat purā kalpe dṛṣṭaṃ vairakaraṃ mahat /
analyzed: dyūtam etat purā kalpe dṛṣṭam vaira karam mahat
translated: This gambling was seen in ancient times to be a great cause of enmity.

original: tasmād dyūtaṃ na seveta hāsyārtham api buddhimān // / //
analyzed: tasmāt dyūtam na seveta hāsya artham api buddhimān
translated: Therefore, even for the sake of amusement, a wise man should not indulge in gambling.

original: pracchannaṃ vā prakāśaṃ vā tan niṣeveta yo naraḥ /
analyzed: pracchannam vā prakāśam vā tat niṣeveta yaḥ naraḥ
translated: If a man resorts to it, whether secretly or openly,

original: tasya daṇḍavikalpaḥ syād yatheṣṭaṃ nṛpates tathā // / //
analyzed: tasya daṇḍa vikalpaḥ syāt yatheṣṭam nṛpateḥ tathā
translated: the king may impose on him any punishment he likes.

original: kṣatraviṭśūdrayonis tu daṇḍaṃ dātum aśaknuvan /
analyzed: kṣatra viś śūdra yoniḥ tu daṇḍam dātum aśaknuvan
translated: But a person born as a Kshatriya, Vaishya, or Shudra, who is unable to pay the fine,

original: ānṛṇyaṃ karmaṇā gacched vipro dadyāc chanaiḥ śanaiḥ // / //
analyzed: ānṛṇyam karmaṇā gacchet vipraḥ dadyāt śanais śanais
translated: may discharge the debt by work, but a Brahmana should pay it slowly.

original: strībālonmattavṛddhānāṃ daridrāṇāṃ ca rogiṇām /
analyzed: strī bāla unmatta vṛddhānām daridrāṇām ca rogiṇām
translated: For women, children, the insane, the aged, the poor, and the sick,

original: śiphāvidalarajjvādyair vidadhyān nṛpatir damam // / //
analyzed: śiphā vidala rajju ādyaiḥ vidadhyāt nṛpatiḥ damam
translated: the king should impose punishment with blades of grass, pieces of wood, ropes, etc.

original: ye niyuktās tu kāryeṣu hanyuḥ kāryāṇi kāryiṇām /
analyzed: ye niyuktāḥ tu kāryeṣu hanyuḥ kāryāṇi kāryiṇām
translated: But those who, when appointed to tasks, destroy the tasks of the litigants,

original: dhanoṣmaṇā pacyamānās tān niḥsvān kārayen nṛpaḥ // / //
analyzed: dhana ūṣmaṇā pacyamānāḥ tān niḥsvān kārayet nṛpaḥ
translated: the king should make them penniless, being cooked by the heat of their wealth.

original: kūṭaśāsanakartṝṃś ca prakṛtīnāṃ ca dūṣakān /
analyzed: kūṭaśāsana kartṝn ca prakṛtīnām ca dūṣakān
translated: Those who issue false royal orders, those who corrupt the people,

original: strībālabrāhmaṇaghnāṃś ca hanyād dviṭsevinas tathā // / //
analyzed: strī bāla brāhmaṇa ghnān ca hanyāt dviṭsevinaḥ tathā
translated: those who kill women, children, and Brahmins, and those who serve enemies, he should kill.

original: tīritaṃ cānuśiṣṭaṃ ca yatra kva cana yad bhavet /
analyzed: tīritam ca anuśiṣṭam ca yatra kva cana yat bhavet
translated: Whatever has been said or instructed, wherever it may be,

original: kṛtaṃ tad dharmato vidyān na tad bhūyo nivartayet // / //
analyzed: kṛtam tat dharmataḥ vidyāt na tat bhūyas nivartayet
translated: that should be known as done according to dharma, and should not be reversed again.

original: amātyāḥ prāḍvivāko vā yat kuryuḥ kāryam anyathā /
analyzed: amātyāḥ prāḍvivākaḥ vā yat kuryuḥ kāryam anyathā
translated: Whatever the ministers or the judge may do contrary to the law,

original: tat svayaṃ nṛpatiḥ kuryāt tān sahasraṃ ca daṇḍayet // / //
analyzed: tat svayam nṛpatiḥ kuryāt tān sahasram ca daṇḍayet
translated: the king himself should do it, and fine them one thousand.

original: brahmahā ca surāpaś ca steyī ca gurutalpagaḥ /
analyzed: brahma hā ca surāpaḥ ca steyī ca gurutalpa gaḥ
translated: The killer of a Brahmin, the drinker of liquor, the thief, and the defiler of the guru's bed,

original: ete sarve pṛthag jñeyā mahāpātakino narāḥ // / //
analyzed: ete sarve pṛthak jñeyāḥ mahāpātakinaḥ narāḥ
translated: all these men should be known separately as great sinners.

original: caturṇām api caiteṣāṃ prāyaścittam akurvatām /🔽śārīraṃ dhanasaṃyuktaṃ daṇḍaṃ dharmyaṃ prakalpayet // / //
analyzed: caturṇām api ca eteṣām prāyaścittam a kurvatām  śārīram dhana saṃyuktam daṇḍam dharmyam prakalpayet
translated: For all of them who do not perform the expiation,🔽he should prescribe a just corporal punishment along with a fine.

original: gurutalpe bhagaḥ kāryaḥ surāpāne surādhvajaḥ /
analyzed: gurutalpe bhagaḥ kāryaḥ surā pāne surā dhvajaḥ
translated: In the case of violating the guru's bed, the punishment should be the Bhaga (genital organ), in the case of drinking liquor, the liquor flag,

original: steye ca śvapadaṃ kāryaṃ brahmahaṇy aśirāḥ pumān // / //
analyzed: steye ca śvapadam kāryam aśirāḥ pumān
translated: in the case of theft, the dog's foot, and in the case of killing a Brahmin, the man without a head.

original: asaṃbhojyā hy asaṃyājyā asaṃpāṭhyā 'vivāhinaḥ /
analyzed: a saṃbhojyāḥ hi a saṃyājyāḥ a saṃpāṭhyāḥ vivāhinaḥ
translated: They are not to be dined with, not to be sacrificed for, not to be recited to, and not to be married to.

original: careyuḥ pṛthivīṃ dīnāḥ sarvadharmabahiṣkṛtāḥ // / //
analyzed: careyuḥ pṛthivīm dīnāḥ sarva dharma bahiṣkṛtāḥ
translated: They should wander over the earth, miserable, excluded from all religious duties.

original: jñātisaṃbandhibhis tv ete tyaktavyāḥ kṛtalakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: jñāti saṃbandhibhiḥ tu ete tyaktavyāḥ kṛta lakṣaṇāḥ
translated: These, when their characteristics have been made known, should be abandoned by their relatives and kinsmen.

original: nirdayā nirnamaskārās tan manor anuśāsanam // / //
analyzed: nirdayāḥ nirnamaskārāḥ tat manoḥ anuśāsanam
translated: They should be without compassion, without salutations; that is the instruction of Manu.

original: prāyaścittaṃ tu kurvāṇāḥ sarvavarṇā yathoditam /
analyzed: prāyaścittam tu kurvāṇāḥ sarva varṇāḥ yathā uditam
translated: But those of all castes who perform the penance as prescribed,

original: nāṅkyā rājñā lalāṭe syur dāpyās tūttamasāhasam // / //
analyzed: na aṅkyāḥ rājñā lalāṭe syuḥ dāpyāḥ tu uttamasāhasam
translated: should not be branded on the forehead by the king, but should be made to pay the highest amercement.

original: āgaḥsu brāhmaṇasyaiva kāryo madhyamasāhasaḥ /
analyzed: āgaḥsu brāhmaṇasya eva kāryaḥ madhyamasāhasaḥ
translated: In the case of a Brahmana, the middlemost amercement should be imposed, even for a mortal sin.

original: vivāsyo vā bhaved rāṣṭrāt sadravyaḥ saparicchadaḥ // / //
analyzed: vivāsyaḥ vā bhavet rāṣṭrāt sa dravyaḥ sa paricchadaḥ
translated: Or he may be banished from the kingdom, with his property and his belongings.

original: itare kṛtavantas tu pāpāny etāny akāmataḥ /
analyzed: itare kṛtavantaḥ tu pāpāni etāni akāmataḥ
translated: But others who have committed these sins unintentionally,

original: sarvasvahāram arhanti kāmatas tu pravāsanam // / //
analyzed: sarva sva hāram arhanti kāmatas tu pravāsanam
translated: should forfeit all their property if they did it intentionally, but if not, they should be banished.

original: nādadīta nṛpaḥ sādhur mahāpātakino dhanam /
analyzed: na ādadīta nṛpaḥ sādhuḥ mahāpātakinaḥ dhanam
translated: A virtuous king should not take the property of a mortal sinner.

original: ādadānas tu tal lobhāt tena doṣeṇa lipyate // / //
analyzed: ādadānaḥ tu tat lobhāt tena doṣeṇa lipyate
translated: But if he takes it out of greed, he becomes tainted with the same sin.

original: apsu praveśya taṃ daṇḍaṃ varuṇāyopapādayet /
analyzed: apsu praveśya tam daṇḍam varuṇāya upapādayet
translated: Having immersed that punishment in water, he should offer it to Varuna.

original: śrutavṛttopapanne vā brāhmaṇe pratipādayet // / //
analyzed: śruta vṛtta upapanne vā brāhmaṇe pratipādayet
translated: Or he should transfer it to a Brahmana endowed with learning and character.

original: īśo daṇḍasya varuṇo rājñāṃ daṇḍadharo hi saḥ /
analyzed: īśaḥ daṇḍasya varuṇaḥ rājñām daṇḍadharaḥ hi saḥ
translated: Varuna is the lord of punishment, for he is the upholder of the rod of punishment for kings.

original: īśaḥ sarvasya jagato brāhmaṇo vedapāragaḥ // / //
analyzed: īśaḥ sarvasya jagataḥ brāhmaṇaḥ vedapāragaḥ
translated: The king, who is the lord of the entire world, should be a brahmin well-versed in the Vedas.

original: yatra varjayate rājā pāpakṛdbhyo dhanāgamam /
analyzed: yatra varjayate rājā pāpa kṛdbhyaḥ dhana āgamam
translated: Where the king avoids the acquisition of wealth from sinful persons,

original: tatra kālena jāyante mānavā dīrghajīvinaḥ // / //
analyzed: tatra kālena jāyante mānavāḥ dīrgha jīvinaḥ
translated: There, in due course, men are born with long lives.

original: niṣpadyante ca sasyāni yathoptāni viśāṃ pṛthak /
analyzed: niṣpadyante ca sasyāni yathā uptāni viśām pṛthak
translated: And crops are produced as sown separately by the people.

original: bālāś ca na pramīyante vikṛtaṃ ca na jāyate // / //🔽brāhmaṇān bādhamānaṃ tu kāmād avaravarṇajam /
analyzed: bālāḥ ca na pramīyante vikṛtam ca na jāyate  brāhmaṇān bādhamānam tu kāmāt avaravarṇajam
translated: And children do not die, and nothing abnormal is born.🔽But the king should kill with various means of execution, causing terror,

original: hanyāc citrair vadhopāyair udvejanakarair nṛpaḥ // / //
analyzed: hanyāt citraiḥ vadha upāyaiḥ udvejana karaiḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: The low-caste person who oppresses the brahmins out of desire.🔽As much sin is seen for a king in killing one who should not be killed,

original: yāvān avadhyasya vadhe tāvān vadhyasya mokṣaṇe /
analyzed: yāvān avadhyasya vadhe tāvān vadhyasya mokṣaṇe
translated: As much merit is there in releasing one who should be killed, by restraining.

original: adharmo nṛpater dṛṣṭo dharmas tu viniyacchataḥ // / //
analyzed: adharmaḥ nṛpateḥ dṛṣṭaḥ dharmaḥ tu viniyacchataḥ
translated: Thus has been stated in detail the decision of law in the eighteen topics,

original: udito 'yaṃ vistaraśo mitho vivādamānayoḥ /🔽aṣṭādaśasu mārgeṣu vyavahārasya nirṇayaḥ // / //
analyzed: uditaḥ yam vistaraśaḥ mithas vivāda mānayoḥ  aṣṭādaśasu mārgeṣu vyavahārasya nirṇayaḥ
translated: For the two parties disputing among themselves.

original: evaṃ dharmyāṇi kāryāṇi samyak kurvan mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: evam dharmyāṇi kāryāṇi samyak kurvan mahīpatiḥ
translated: Thus the king, properly performing his righteous duties,

original: deśān alabdhāṃl lipseta labdhāṃś ca paripālayet // / //
analyzed: deśān a labdhān lipseta labdhān ca paripālayet
translated: Should seek to gain countries that are not yet gained, and protect those that are gained.

original: samyaṅ niviṣṭadeśas tu kṛtadurgaś ca śāstrataḥ /
analyzed: samyak niviṣṭa deśaḥ tu kṛta durgaḥ ca śāstrataḥ
translated: Having properly settled his country and having built forts according to the scriptures,

original: kaṇṭakoddharaṇe nityam ātiṣṭhed yatnam uttamam // / //🔽rakṣanād āryavṛttānāṃ kaṇṭakānāṃ ca śodhanāt /
analyzed: kaṇṭaka uddharaṇe nityam ātiṣṭhet yatnam uttamam  rakṣanāt ārya vṛttānām kaṇṭakānām ca śodhanāt
translated: He should always make the best effort to remove the thorns.

original: narendrās tridivaṃ yānti prajāpālanatatparāḥ // / //
analyzed: narendrāḥ tridivam yānti prajā pālana tatparāḥ
translated: The kings, intent on protecting the people, go to heaven by protecting those of noble conduct and by removing the thorns.

original: aśāsaṃs taskarān yas tu baliṃ gṛhṇāti pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: aśāsān taskarān yaḥ tu balim gṛhṇāti pārthivaḥ
translated: But that king who collects taxes without punishing thieves,

original: tasya prakṣubhyate rāṣṭraṃ svargāc ca parihīyate // / //
analyzed: tasya prakṣubhyate rāṣṭram svargāt ca parihīyate
translated: his kingdom is agitated and he is deprived of heaven.

original: nirbhayaṃ tu bhaved yasya rāṣṭraṃ bāhubalāśritam /
analyzed: nirbhayam tu bhavet yasya rāṣṭram bāhu bala āśritam
translated: But that kingdom which is fearless, relying on the strength of its arms,

original: tasya tad vardhate nityaṃ sicyamāna iva drumaḥ // / //🔽dvividhāṃs taskarān vidyāt paradravyāpahārakān /
analyzed: tasya tat vardhate nityam sicyamānaḥ iva drumaḥ  dvividhān taskarān vidyāt para dravya apahārakān
translated: its prosperity always increases, like a tree being watered.🔽The king, with the eyes of spies, should know that there are two kinds of thieves who steal the property of others:

original: prakāśāṃś cāprakāśāṃś ca cāracakṣur mahīpatiḥ // / //
analyzed: prakāśān ca aprakāśān ca cāra cakṣuḥ mahīpatiḥ
translated: the manifest and the unmanifest.

original: prakāśavañcakās teṣāṃ nānāpaṇyopajīvinaḥ /🔽pracchannavañcakās tv ete ye stenāṭavikādayaḥ // / //
analyzed: prakāśa vañcakāḥ teṣām nānā paṇya upajīvinaḥ  pracchanna vañcakāḥ tu ete ye stena āṭavika ādayaḥ
translated: Among them, the manifest are those who live by various trades.🔽But these are the unmanifest thieves, who are thieves, foresters, and so on.

original: utkocakāś cāupadhikā vañcakāḥ kitavās tathā /
analyzed: utkocakāḥ ca aupadhikāḥ vañcakāḥ kitavāḥ tathā
translated: Those who cheat by fraud, those who cheat by deceit, gamblers,

original: maṅgalādeśavṛttāś ca bhadrāś cekṣaṇikaiḥ saha // / //
analyzed: maṅgalādeśavṛttāḥ ca bhadrāḥ ca īkṣaṇikaiḥ saha
translated: and those who live by predicting auspicious times, along with fortune-tellers,

original: asamyakkāriṇaś caiva mahāmātrāś cikitsakāḥ /
analyzed: asamyakkāriṇaḥ ca eva mahāmātrāḥ cikitsakāḥ
translated: those who act improperly, and high officials and physicians,

original: śilpopacārayuktāś ca nipuṇāḥ paṇyayoṣitaḥ // / //
analyzed: śilpa upacāra yuktāḥ ca nipuṇāḥ paṇya yoṣitaḥ
translated: and clever courtesans skilled in the arts and services.

original: evamādīn vijānīyāt prakāśāṃl lokakaṇṭakān /
analyzed: evamādīn vijānīyāt prakāśān lokakaṇṭakān
translated: One should know such people who are openly the thorns of the people,

original: nigūḍhacāriṇaś cānyān anāryān āryaliṅginaḥ // / //🔽tān viditvā sucaritair gūḍhais tatkarmakāribhiḥ /
analyzed: nigūḍha cāriṇaḥ ca anyān anāryān ārya liṅginaḥ  tān viditvā su caritaiḥ gūḍhaiḥ tad karma kāribhiḥ
translated: and others who move in secret, the ignoble ones who bear the marks of the noble.

original: cāraiś cānekasaṃsthānaiḥ protsādya vaśam ānayet // / //
analyzed: cāraiḥ ca aneka saṃsthānaiḥ protsādya vaśam ānayet
translated: Having known them, he should exterminate them and bring them under control through his well-behaved spies who perform their duties secretly,🔽and through spies of various forms.

original: teṣāṃ doṣān abhikhyāpya sve sve karmaṇi tattvataḥ /
analyzed: teṣām doṣān abhikhyāpya sve sve karmaṇi tattvataḥ
translated: Having proclaimed their faults in their respective duties truthfully,

original: kurvīta śāsanaṃ rājā samyak sārāparādhataḥ // / //
analyzed: kurvīta śāsanam rājā samyak sāra aparādhataḥ
translated: the king should mete out punishment properly according to the gravity of the offense.

original: na hi daṇḍād ṛte śakyaḥ kartuṃ pāpavinigrahaḥ /🔽stenānāṃ pāpabuddhīnāṃ nibhṛtaṃ caratāṃ kṣitau // / //🔽sabhāprapāpūpaśālā veśamadyānnavikrayāḥ /
analyzed: na hi daṇḍāt ṛte śakyaḥ kartum pāpa vinigrahaḥ  stenānām pāpa buddhīnām nibhṛtam caratām kṣitau  sabhā prapā apūpa śālāḥ veśa madya anna vikrayāḥ
translated: For without punishment, it is not possible to control the wicked,🔽the thieves with evil intentions who move stealthily on the earth.🔽Courts, wells, bakeries, brothels, liquor and food shops,

original: catuṣpathāṃś caityavṛkṣāḥ samājāḥ prekṣaṇāni ca // / //🔽jīrṇodyānāny araṇyāni kārukāveśanāni ca /
analyzed: catuṣpathān caityavṛkṣāḥ samājāḥ prekṣaṇāni ca  jīrṇa udyānāni araṇyāni kārukā āveśanāni ca
translated: crossroads, trees worshipped by the people, assemblies, and shows,🔽old gardens, forests, and the houses of actors,

original: śūnyāni cāpy agārāṇi vanāny upavanāni ca // / //
analyzed: śūnyāni ca api agārāṇi vanāni upavanāni ca
translated: empty houses, and gardens -

original: evaṃvidhān nṛpo deśān gulmaiḥ sthāvarajaṅgamaiḥ /
analyzed: evaṃvidhān nṛpaḥ deśān gulmaiḥ sthāvara jaṅgamaiḥ
translated: the king should protect such places with mobile and stationary guards.

original: taskarapratiṣedhārthaṃ cāraiś cāpy anucārayet // / //
analyzed: taskara pratiṣedha artham cāraiḥ ca api anucārayet
translated: And for the purpose of preventing thieves, he should also have them followed by spies.

original: tatsahāyair anugatair nānākarmapravedibhiḥ /
analyzed: tad sahāyaiḥ anugataiḥ nānā karma pravedibhiḥ
translated: By those who are their associates, who follow them, who know various kinds of work,

original: vidyād utsādayec caiva nipuṇaiḥ pūrvataskaraiḥ // / //
analyzed: vidyāt utsādayet ca eva nipuṇaiḥ pūrva taskaraiḥ
translated: And by skillful former thieves, he should find out and destroy them.

original: bhakṣyabhojyopadeśaiś ca brāhmaṇānāṃ ca darśanaiḥ /
analyzed: bhakṣya bhojya upadeśaiḥ ca brāhmaṇānām ca darśanaiḥ
translated: By giving advice about food and drink, and by showing respect to Brahmins,

original: śauryakarmāpadeśaiś ca kuryus teṣāṃ samāgamam // / //
analyzed: śaurya karma apadeśaiḥ ca kuryuḥ teṣām samāgamam
translated: And by boasting about their heroic deeds, they should bring about their meeting.

original: ye tatra nopasarpeyur mūlapraṇihitāś ca ye /
analyzed: ye tatra na upasarpeyuḥ mūla praṇihitāḥ ca ye
translated: Those who do not approach there, and those who are previously engaged,

original: tān prasahya nṛpo hanyāt samitrajñātibāndhavān // / //
analyzed: tān prasahya nṛpaḥ hanyāt sa mitra jñāti bāndhavān
translated: The king should forcibly kill them, along with their friends, relatives, and kinsmen.

original: na hoḍhena vinā cauraṃ ghātayed dhārmiko nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: na hoḍhena vinā cauram ghātayet dhārmikaḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: A righteous king should not have a thief killed without the stolen goods.

original: sahoḍhaṃ sopakaraṇaṃ ghātayed avicārayan // / //
analyzed: sahoḍham sa upakaraṇam ghātayet a vicārayan
translated: Without hesitation, he should have the thief killed along with the stolen goods and the instruments of the crime.

original: grāmeṣv api ca ye ke cic caurāṇāṃ bhaktadāyakāḥ /
analyzed: grāmeṣu api ca ye ke cit caurāṇām bhakta dāyakāḥ
translated: And even those in villages who provide food for thieves,

original: bhāṇḍāvakāśadāś caiva sarvāṃs tān api ghātayet // / //
analyzed: bhāṇḍāvakāśadāḥ ca eva sarvān tān api ghātayet
translated: And those who provide them with storage space, all of them he should have killed.

original: rāṣṭreṣu rakṣādhikṛtān sāmantāṃś caiva coditān /
analyzed: rāṣṭreṣu rakṣā adhikṛtān sāmantān ca eva coditān
translated: Those in charge of security in the kingdom, and the neighboring lords who are appointed,

original: abhyāghāteṣu madhyasthāñ śiṣyāc caurān iva drutam // / //
analyzed: abhyāghāteṣu madhyasthām śiṣyāt caurān iva drutam
translated: Who remain neutral in attacks, he should punish quickly, like thieves.

original: yaś cāpi dharmasamayāt pracyuto dharmajīvanaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca api dharma samayāt pracyutaḥ dharma jīvanaḥ
translated: And he who has fallen from the rule of Dharma, who lives by Dharma,

original: daṇḍenaiva tam apy oṣet svakād dharmād dhi vicyutam // / //
analyzed: daṇḍena eva tam api oṣet svakāt dharmāt hi vicyutam
translated: One should punish him also with the rod, who has deviated from his own duty.

original: grāmaghāte hitābhaṅge pathi moṣābhidarśane /
analyzed: grāma ghāte hitā bhaṅge pathi moṣa abhidarśane
translated: In the case of the destruction of a village, the breaking of a dam, and the display of robbery on the road,

original: śaktito nābhidhāvanto nirvāsyāḥ saparicchadāḥ // / //🔽rājñaḥ kośāpahartṝṃś ca pratikūleṣu ca sthitān /
analyzed: śaktitaḥ na abhidhāvantaḥ nirvāsyāḥ sa paricchadāḥ  rājñaḥ kośa apahartṝn ca pratikūleṣu ca sthitān
translated: those who do not run to the best of their ability, along with their retinue, should be banished.🔽And those who steal the king's treasury, and those who stand with the disaffected,

original: ghātayed vividhair daṇḍair arīṇāṃ copajāpakān // / //
analyzed: ghātayet vividhaiḥ daṇḍaiḥ arīṇām ca upajāpakān
translated: the king should have them killed with various punishments, and those who conspire with the enemies.

original: saṃdhiṃ chittvā tu ye cauryaṃ rātrau kurvanti taskarāḥ /🔽teṣāṃ chittvā nṛpo hastau tīkṣṇe śūle niveśayet // / //
analyzed: saṃdhim chittvā tu ye cauryam rātrau kurvanti taskarāḥ  teṣām chittvā nṛpaḥ hastau tīkṣṇe śūle niveśayet
translated: Those thieves who break the peace and commit theft at night,🔽the king should have their hands cut off and impale them on a sharp stake.

original: aṅgulīr granthibhedasya chedayet prathame grahe /
analyzed: aṅgulīḥ granthibhedasya chedayet prathame grahe
translated: For one who breaks the seal, the king should cut off the fingers in the first offense.

original: dvitīye hastacaraṇau tṛtīye vadham arhati // / //
analyzed: dvitīye hasta caraṇau tṛtīye vadham arhati
translated: In the second, the hands and feet, and in the third, he deserves death.

original: agnidān bhaktadāṃś caiva tathā śastrāvakāśadān /
analyzed: agnidān bhakta dān ca eva tathā śastra avakāśa dān
translated: Those who give fire, food, and also weapons, and those who supply the means of theft,

original: saṃnidhātṝṃś ca moṣasya hanyāc cauram iveśvaraḥ // / //🔽taḍāgabhedakaṃ hanyād apsu śuddhavadhena vā /
analyzed: saṃnidhātṝn ca moṣasya hanyāt cauram iva īśvaraḥ  taḍāga bhedakam hanyāt apsu śuddha vadhena vā
translated: the king should have them killed like a thief.🔽One should kill the digger of a tank, or punish him with the Uttama-sâhasa fine,

original: yad vāpi pratisaṃskuryād dāpyas tūttamasāhasam // / //
analyzed: yat vā api pratisaṃskuryāt dāpyaḥ tu uttamasāhasam
translated: or he may be made to restore it to its former condition.

original: koṣṭhāgārāyudhāgāra devatāgārabhedakān /
analyzed: koṣṭhāgāra āyudhāgāra devatāgāra bhedakān
translated: Those who break into a granary, an armoury, or a temple,

original: hastyaśvarathahartṝṃś ca hanyād evāvicārayan // / //🔽yas tu pūrvaniviṣṭasya taḍāgasyodakaṃ haret /
analyzed: hasti aśva ratha hartṝn ca hanyāt eva a vicārayan  yaḥ tu pūrva niviṣṭasya taḍāgasya udakam haret
translated: He should unhesitatingly kill those who steal elephants, horses, and chariots.🔽But he who diverts the water of a tank constructed earlier,

original: āgamaṃ vāpy apāṃ bhindyāt sa dāpyaḥ pūrvasāhasam // / //
analyzed: āgamam vā api apām bhindyāt sa dāpyaḥ pūrvasāhasam
translated: Or breaks the source of water, should be made to pay the first sāhasa fine.

original: samutsṛjed rājamārge yas tv amedhyam anāpadi /
analyzed: samutsṛjet rājamārge yaḥ tu amedhyam anāpadi
translated: But he who throws impure substances on the royal road in an emergency,

original: sa dvau kārṣāpaṇau dadyād amedhyaṃ cāśu śodhayet // / //
analyzed: sa dvau kārṣāpaṇau dadyāt amedhyam ca āśu śodhayet
translated: Should pay two kārṣāpaṇas and quickly purify the impure substance.

original: āpadgato 'tha vā vṛddhā garbhiṇī bāla eva vā /
analyzed: vā vṛddhā garbhiṇī bālaḥ eva vā
translated: But one who is in an emergency, or is old, pregnant, or a child,

original: paribhāṣaṇam arhanti tac ca śodhyam iti sthitiḥ // / //
analyzed: paribhāṣaṇam arhanti tat ca śodhyam iti sthitiḥ
translated: Deserves reprimand, and that should be purified - this is the settled rule.

original: cikitsakānāṃ sarveṣāṃ mithyāpracaratāṃ damaḥ /
analyzed: cikitsakānām sarveṣām mithyā pracaratām damaḥ
translated: The fine for all physicians acting falsely,

original: amānuṣeṣu prathamo mānuṣeṣu tu madhyamaḥ // / //
analyzed: amānuṣeṣu prathamaḥ mānuṣeṣu tu madhyamaḥ
translated: Is the first sāhasa in the case of non-human beings, but the middle one in the case of humans.

original: saṃkramadhvajayaṣṭīnāṃ pratimānāṃ ca bhedakaḥ /
analyzed: saṃkrama dhvaja yaṣṭīnām pratimānām ca bhedakaḥ
translated: The one who breaks bridges, flags, poles, and images,

original: pratikuryāc ca tat sarvaṃ pañca dadyāc chatāni ca // / //🔽adūṣitānāṃ dravyāṇāṃ dūṣaṇe bhedane tathā /🔽maṇīnām apavedhe ca daṇḍaḥ prathamasāhasaḥ // / //
analyzed: pratikuryāt ca tat sarvam pañca dadyāt śatāni ca  a dūṣitānām dravyāṇām dūṣaṇe bhedane tathā  maṇīnām apavedhe ca daṇḍaḥ prathama sāhasaḥ
translated: Should restore all that and pay five hundred.🔽In the case of defiling or breaking uncontaminated substances,🔽And in the case of piercing gems, the fine is the first sāhasa.

original: samair hi viṣamaṃ yas tu cared vai mūlyato 'pi vā /
analyzed: samaiḥ hi viṣamam yaḥ tu caret vai vā
translated: But he who deals unfairly with equals, even for a price,

original: samāpnuyād damaṃ pūrvaṃ naro madhyamam eva vā // / //
analyzed: samāpnuyāt damam pūrvam naraḥ madhyamam eva vā
translated: should be punished with the first or middle amercement.

original: bandhanāni ca sarvāṇi rājā mārge niveśayet /
analyzed: bandhanāni ca sarvāṇi rājā mārge niveśayet
translated: All the prisons should be placed on the king's road,

original: duḥkhitā yatra dṛśyeran vikṛtāḥ pāpakāriṇah // / //🔽prākārasya ca bhettāraṃ parikhāṇāṃ ca pūrakam /
analyzed: duḥkhitāḥ yatra dṛśyeran vikṛtāḥ pāpa kāriṇah  prākārasya ca bhettāram parikhāṇām ca pūrakam
translated: where the miserable, deformed, and sinful ones can be seen.🔽One who breaks the rampart, fills up the moats,

original: dvārāṇāṃ caiva bhaṅktāraṃ kṣipram eva pravāsayet // / //
analyzed: dvārāṇām ca eva bhaṅktāram kṣipram eva pravāsayet
translated: and destroys the gates should be quickly exiled.

original: abhicāreṣu sarveṣu kartavyo dviśato damaḥ /
analyzed: abhicāreṣu sarveṣu kartavyaḥ dviśataḥ damaḥ
translated: In all cases of sorcery, the punishment should be two hundred (panas).

original: mūlakarmaṇi cānāpteḥ kṛtyāsu vividhāsu ca // / //
analyzed: mūlakarmaṇi ca anāpteḥ kṛtyāsu vividhāsu ca
translated: In the case of root-magic and in various kinds of witchcraft,

original: abījavikrayī caiva bījotkṛṣṭā tathaiva ca /
analyzed: abīja vikrayī ca eva bīja utkṛṣṭā tathā eva ca
translated: one who sells seeds without seeds, and one who steals seeds,

original: maryādābhedakaś caiva vikṛtaṃ prāpnuyād vadham // / //🔽sarvakaṇṭakapāpiṣṭhaṃ hemakāraṃ tu pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: maryādā bhedakaḥ ca eva vikṛtam prāpnuyāt vadham  sarva kaṇṭaka pāpiṣṭham hemakāram tu pārthivaḥ
translated: and one who breaks the boundaries should receive a modified death penalty.🔽The king should cut to pieces with razors the most contemptible of all thorns, the goldsmith,

original: pravartamānam anyāye chedayel lavaśaḥ kṣuraiḥ // / //
analyzed: pravartamānam anyāye chedayet lavaśas kṣuraiḥ
translated: if he is found guilty of dishonest practices.

original: sītādravyāpaharaṇe śastrāṇām auṣadhasya ca /
analyzed: sītā dravya apaharaṇe śastrāṇām auṣadhasya ca
translated: In the case of stealing gold and silver articles, weapons, and medicines,

original: kālam āsādya kāryaṃ ca rājā daṇḍaṃ prakalpayet // / //
analyzed: kālam āsādya kāryam ca rājā daṇḍam prakalpayet
translated: the king should determine the punishment according to the time and the purpose.

original: svāmyamātyau puraṃ rāṣṭraṃ kośadaṇḍau suhṛt tathā /
analyzed: svāmi amātyau puram rāṣṭram kośa daṇḍau suhṛd tathā
translated: The king, the minister, the city, the country, the treasury, the army, and the ally,

original: sapta prakṛtayo hy etāḥ saptāṅgaṃ rājyam ucyate // / //🔽saptānāṃ prakṛtīnāṃ tu rājyasyāsāṃ yathākramam /
analyzed: sapta prakṛtayaḥ hi etāḥ sapta aṅgam rājyam ucyate  saptānām prakṛtīnām tu rājyasya āsām yathākramam
translated: These seven constituents are said to be the seven limbs of the kingdom.

original: pūrvaṃ pūrvaṃ gurutaraṃ jānīyād vyasanaṃ mahat // / //
analyzed: pūrvam pūrvam gurutaram jānīyāt vyasanam mahat
translated: Of these seven constituents of the kingdom, one should know that the earlier ones are more important and more serious in case of trouble.

original: saptāṅgasyeha rājyasya viṣṭabdhasya tridaṇḍavat /
analyzed: sapta aṅgasya iha rājyasya viṣṭabdhasya tridaṇḍa vat
translated: Here, of the seven-limbed kingdom, which is supported like a tripod,

original: anyonyaguṇavaiśeṣyān na kiṃ cid atiricyate // / //
analyzed: anyonya guṇa vaiśeṣyāt na kim cit atiricyate
translated: nothing excels the others because of the specific qualities of each.

original: teṣu teṣu tu kṛtyeṣu tat tad aṅgaṃ viśiṣyate /
analyzed: teṣu teṣu tu kṛtyeṣu tat tat aṅgam viśiṣyate
translated: But in this or that task, this or that limb is distinguished.

original: yena yat sādhyate kāryaṃ tat tasmiñ śreṣṭham ucyate // / //🔽cāreṇotsāhayogena kriyayaiva ca karmaṇām /
analyzed: yena yat sādhyate kāryam tat tasmin śreṣṭham ucyate  cāreṇa utsāha yogena kriyayā eva ca karmaṇām
translated: That by which a certain task is accomplished, that is said to be the best in that.

original: svaśaktiṃ paraśaktiṃ ca nityaṃ vidyān mahīpatiḥ // / //
analyzed: sva śaktim para śaktim ca nityam vidyāt mahīpatiḥ
translated: The king should always know his own strength and the strength of others through espionage, through the application of enthusiasm, and through the very performance of actions.

original: pīḍanāni ca sarvāṇi vyasanāni tathaiva ca /
analyzed: pīḍanāni ca sarvāṇi vyasanāni tathā eva ca
translated: And all kinds of oppression and vices,

original: ārabheta tataḥ kāryaṃ saṃcintya gurulāghavam // / //
analyzed: ārabheta tatas kāryam saṃcintya gurulāghavam
translated: then one should undertake an action, having considered its importance and insignificance.

original: ārabhetaiva karmāṇi śrāntaḥ śrāntaḥ punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: ārabheta eva karmāṇi śrāntaḥ śrāntaḥ punar punar
translated: One should repeatedly begin actions, though tired again and again.

original: karmāṇy ārabhamāṇaṃ hi puruṣaṃ śrīr niṣevate // / //
analyzed: karmāṇi ārabhamāṇam hi puruṣam śrīḥ niṣevate
translated: For prosperity attends the man who begins actions.

original: kṛtaṃ tretāyugaṃ caiva dvāparaṃ kalir eva ca /
analyzed: kṛtam tretā yugam ca eva dvāparam kaliḥ eva ca
translated: The Kṛta age, the Tretā age, the Dvāpara age, and the Kali age,

original: rājño vṛttāni sarvāṇi rājā hi yugam ucyate // / //
analyzed: rājñaḥ vṛttāni sarvāṇi rājā hi yugam ucyate
translated: The king is said to be the combination of all the duties of a king.

original: kaliḥ prasupto bhavati sa jāgrad dvāparaṃ yugam /
analyzed: kaliḥ prasuptaḥ bhavati sa jāgrat dvāparam yugam
translated: When Kali is asleep, it is the Dvapara age;

original: karmasv abhyudyatas tretā vicaraṃs tu kṛtaṃ yugam // / //🔽indrasyārkasya vāyoś ca yamasya varuṇasya ca /
analyzed: karmasu abhyudyataḥ tretā vicaran tu kṛtam yugam  indrasya arkasya vāyoḥ ca yamasya varuṇasya ca
translated: when engaged in work, it is the Treta age; when moving about, it is the Krita age.🔽The king should conduct himself with the same energy as Indra, the sun, Vayu, Yama, Varuna,

original: candrasyāgneḥ pṛthivyāś ca tejovṛttaṃ nṛpaś caret // / //
analyzed: candrasya agneḥ pṛthivyāḥ ca tejaḥ vṛttam nṛpaḥ caret
translated: the moon, Agni, and the earth.

original: vārṣikāṃś caturo māsān yathendro 'bhipravarṣati /
analyzed: vārṣikān caturaḥ māsān yathā indraḥ bhipravarṣati
translated: For four months of the rainy season, just as Indra showers rain,

original: tathābhivarṣet svaṃ rāṣṭraṃ kāmair indravrataṃ caran // / //
analyzed: tathā abhivarṣet svam rāṣṭram kāmaiḥ indravratam caran
translated: the king, observing the vow of Indra, should shower benefits on his kingdom.

original: aṣṭau māsān yathādityas toyaṃ harati raśmibhiḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭau māsān yathā ādityaḥ toyam harati raśmibhiḥ
translated: Just as the sun, for eight months, draws up water with its rays,

original: tathā haret karaṃ rāṣṭrān nityam arkavrataṃ hi tat // / //
analyzed: tathā haret karam rāṣṭrāt nityam arkavratam hi tat
translated: the king should collect taxes from the kingdom; that is the vow of the sun.

original: praviśya sarvabhūtāni yathā carati mārutaḥ /
analyzed: praviśya sarva bhūtāni yathā carati mārutaḥ
translated: Just as the wind moves through all beings,

original: tathā cāraiḥ praveṣṭavyaṃ vratam etad dhi mārutam // / //
analyzed: tathā cāraiḥ praveṣṭavyam vratam etat hi mārutam
translated: the king should move through his kingdom with spies; that is the vow of the wind.

original: yathā yamaḥ priyadveṣyau prāpte kāle niyacchati /
analyzed: yathā yamaḥ priya dveṣyau prāpte kāle niyacchati
translated: Just as Yama restrains the dear and the hated when the time comes,

original: tathā rājñā niyantavyāḥ prajās tad dhi yamavratam // / //
analyzed: tathā rājñā niyantavyāḥ prajāḥ tat hi yamavratam
translated: the king should restrain his subjects; that is the vow of Yama.

original: varuṇena yathā pāśair baddha evābhidṛśyate /
analyzed: varuṇena yathā pāśaiḥ baddhaḥ eva abhidṛśyate
translated: Just as one is seen bound by the nooses of Varuṇa,

original: tathā pāpān nigṛhṇīyād vratam etad dhi vāruṇam // / //
analyzed: tathā pāpān nigṛhṇīyāt vratam etat hi vāruṇam
translated: so should one restrain the wicked. This is the vow of Varuṇa.

original: paripūrṇaṃ yathā candraṃ dṛṣṭvā hṛṣyanti mānavāḥ /
analyzed: paripūrṇam yathā candram dṛṣṭvā hṛṣyanti mānavāḥ
translated: Just as people are delighted on seeing the full moon,

original: tathā prakṛtayo yasmin sa cāndravratiko nṛpaḥ // / //🔽pratāpayuktas tejasvī nityaṃ syāt pāpakarmasu /
analyzed: tathā prakṛtayaḥ yasmin sa cāndravratikaḥ nṛpaḥ  pratāpa yuktaḥ tejasvī nityam syāt pāpa karmasu
translated: so are the subjects in a king who is like the moon in his conduct.🔽A king who is endowed with prowess and splendor, and is always engaged in sinful acts,

original: duṣṭasāmantahiṃsraś ca tad āgneyaṃ vrataṃ smṛtam // / //
analyzed: duṣṭa sāmanta hiṃsraḥ ca tat āgneyam vratam smṛtam
translated: and who injures wicked vassals, is said to have the vow of Agni.

original: yathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni dharā dhārayate samam /
analyzed: yathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni dharā dhārayate samam
translated: Just as the earth equally supports all beings,

original: tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni bibhrataḥ pārthivaṃ vratam // / //🔽etair upāyair anyaiś ca yukto nityam atandritaḥ /
analyzed: tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni bibhrataḥ pārthivam vratam  etaiḥ upāyaiḥ anyaiḥ ca yuktaḥ nityam atandritaḥ
translated: so does the king who supports all beings have the vow of the king.🔽A king, who is always diligent and endowed with these and other means,

original: stenān rājā nigṛhṇīyāt svarāṣṭre para eva ca // / //
analyzed: stenān rājā nigṛhṇīyāt sva rāṣṭre pare eva ca
translated: should restrain thieves in his own kingdom and in that of others.

original: parām apy āpadaṃ prāpto brāhmaṇān na prakopayet /🔽te hy enaṃ kupitā hanyuḥ sadyaḥ sabalavāhanam // / //
analyzed: parām api āpadam prāptaḥ brāhmaṇān na prakopayet  te hi enam kupitāḥ hanyuḥ sadyas sa bala vāhanam
translated: Even if he has fallen into great calamity, he should not anger the Brahmins.🔽For if they are angered, they can instantly destroy him along with his army and vehicles.

original: yaiḥ kṛtaḥ sarvabhakṣyo 'gnir apeyaś ca mahodadhiḥ /
analyzed: yaiḥ kṛtaḥ sarva bhakṣyaḥ gniḥ apeyaḥ ca mahā udadhiḥ
translated: By them, fire, which can consume everything, and the great ocean, which cannot be drunk, were created.

original: kṣayī cāpyāyitaḥ somaḥ ko na naśyet prakopya tān // / //
analyzed: kṣayī ca āpyāyitaḥ somaḥ kaḥ na naśyet prakopya tān
translated: and the moon, though waning, is replenished. Who is there that would not perish by provoking them?

original: lokān anyān sṛjeyur ye lokapālāṃś ca kopitāḥ /
analyzed: lokān anyān sṛjeyuḥ ye lokapālān ca kopitāḥ
translated: They who, when provoked, could create other worlds and other guardians of the world,

original: devān kuryur adevāṃś ca kaḥ kṣiṇvaṃs tān samṛdhnuyāt // / //
analyzed: devān kuryuḥ adevān ca kaḥ kṣiṇvan tān samṛdhnuyāt
translated: and could make the gods cease to be gods, who is there that, having injured them, could prosper?

original: yān upāśritya tiṣṭhanti lokā devāś ca sarvadā /
analyzed: yān upāśritya tiṣṭhanti lokāḥ devāḥ ca sarvadā
translated: On whom the worlds and the gods always depend,

original: brahma caiva dhanaṃ yeṣāṃ ko hiṃsyāt tāñ jijīviṣuḥ // / //
analyzed: brahma ca eva dhanam yeṣām kaḥ hiṃsyāt tām jijīviṣuḥ
translated: whose wealth is the Veda, who is there that, desiring to live, would injure them?

original: avidvāṃś caiva vidvāṃś ca brāhmaṇo daivataṃ mahat /
analyzed: a vidvān ca eva vidvān ca brāhmaṇaḥ daivatam mahat
translated: Whether ignorant or learned, a Brahmana is a great divinity;

original: praṇītaś cāpraṇītaś ca yathāgnir daivataṃ mahat // / //
analyzed: praṇītaḥ ca a praṇītaḥ ca yathā agniḥ daivatam mahat
translated: whether consecrated or not consecrated, he is like a great divinity, like fire.

original: śmaśāneṣv api tejasvī pāvako naiva duṣyati /
analyzed: śmaśāneṣu api tejasvī pāvakaḥ nā eva duṣyati
translated: Even in cremation grounds, the radiant fire is not defiled;

original: hūyamānaś ca yajñeṣu bhūya evābhivardhate // / //
analyzed: hūyamānaḥ ca yajñeṣu bhūyas eva abhivardhate
translated: and when offered in sacrifices, it increases greatly.

original: evaṃ yady apy aniṣṭeṣu vartante sarvakarmasu /
analyzed: evam yadi api aniṣṭeṣu vartante sarva karmasu
translated: Even if they behave badly in all their actions,

original: sarvathā brāhmaṇāḥ pūjyāḥ paramaṃ daivataṃ hi tat // / //🔽kṣatrasyātipravṛddhasya brāhmaṇān prati sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: sarvathā brāhmaṇāḥ pūjyāḥ paramam daivatam hi tat  kṣatrasya atipravṛddhasya brāhmaṇān prati sarvaśas
translated: the Brahmanas should always be worshipped, for they are the highest divinity.🔽When the Kshatriyas become too powerful towards the Brahmanas in every way,

original: brahmaiva saṃniyantṛ syāt kṣatraṃ hi brahmasaṃbhavam // / //
analyzed: brahmā eva saṃniyantṛ syāt kṣatram hi brahma saṃbhavam
translated: the Brahmanas themselves should restrain them, for the Kshatriyas originate from the Brahmanas.

original: adbhyo 'gnir brahmataḥ kṣatram aśmano loham utthitam /
analyzed: adbhyaḥ gniḥ brahmataḥ kṣatram aśmanaḥ loham utthitam
translated: Fire is born from water, the Kshatriya from the Brahmana, and iron from stone.

original: teṣāṃ sarvatragaṃ tejaḥ svāsu yoniṣu śāmyati // / //
analyzed: teṣām sarvatragam tejaḥ svāsu yoniṣu śāmyati
translated: The all-pervading energy of these is pacified in their respective sources.

original: nābrahma kṣatram ṛdhnoti nākṣatraṃ brahma vardhate /
analyzed: na abrahma kṣatram ṛdhnoti na akṣatram brahma vardhate
translated: The Kshatriya cannot prosper without the Brahmana, nor the Brahmana without the Kshatriya.

original: brahma kṣatraṃ ca saṃpṛktam iha cāmutra vardhate // / //
analyzed: brahma kṣatram ca saṃpṛktam iha ca amutra vardhate
translated: When the Brahmana and the Kshatriya are united, they prosper both here and in the next world.

original: dattvā dhanaṃ tu viprebhyaḥ sarvadaṇḍasamutthitam /
analyzed: dattvā dhanam tu viprebhyaḥ sarva daṇḍa samutthitam
translated: Having given wealth to the Brahmanas, collected from all the fines,

original: putre rājyaṃ samāsṛjya kurvīta prāyaṇaṃ raṇe // / //
analyzed: putre rājyam samāsṛjya kurvīta prāyaṇam raṇe
translated: and having entrusted the kingdom to his son, he should bring about his end in battle.

original: evaṃ caran sadā yukto rājadharmeṣu pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: evam caran sadā yuktaḥ rāja dharmeṣu pārthivaḥ
translated: Thus behaving and always engaged in the duties of a king, the king

original: hiteṣu caiva lokasya sarvān bhṛtyān niyojayet // / //
analyzed: hiteṣu ca eva lokasya sarvān bhṛtyān niyojayet
translated: should employ all his servants in the welfare of the people.

original: eṣo 'khilaḥ karmavidhir ukto rājñaḥ sanātanaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa u khilaḥ karma vidhiḥ uktaḥ rājñaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: Thus has been declared the eternal law of action for the king in its entirety.

original: imaṃ karmavidhiṃ vidyāt kramaśo vaiśyaśūdrayoḥ // / //
analyzed: imam karma vidhim vidyāt kramaśas vaiśya śūdrayoḥ
translated: This law of action should be known to apply, in due order, to the Vaishya and the Shudra.

original: vaiśyas tu kṛtasaṃskāraḥ kṛtvā dāraparigraham /
analyzed: vaiśyaḥ tu kṛta saṃskāraḥ kṛtvā dāra parigraham
translated: The Vaishya, having undergone the sacraments, and having taken a wife,

original: vārtāyāṃ nityayuktaḥ syāt paśūnāṃ caiva rakṣaṇe // / //
analyzed: vārtāyām nitya yuktaḥ syāt paśūnām ca eva rakṣaṇe
translated: should always be engaged in agriculture and in the protection of cattle.

original: prajāpatir hi vaiśyāya sṛṣṭvā paridade paśūn /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ hi vaiśyāya sṛṣṭvā paridade paśūn
translated: For Prajapati, having created the Vaishya, gave him the cattle.

original: brāhmaṇāya ca rājñe ca sarvāḥ paridade prajāḥ // / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇāya ca rājñe ca sarvāḥ paridade prajāḥ
translated: He gave all subjects to the Brahmins and the king.

original: na ca vaiśyasya kāmaḥ syān na rakṣeyaṃ paśūn iti /
analyzed: na ca vaiśyasya kāmaḥ syāt na rakṣeyam paśūn iti
translated: And for a Vaishya, there should be no desire to think, I should not protect animals.

original: vaiśye cecchati nānyena rakṣitavyāḥ kathaṃ cana // / //🔽maṇimuktāpravālānāṃ lohānāṃ tāntavasya ca /
analyzed: vaiśye ca icchati na anyena rakṣitavyāḥ katham cana  maṇi muktā pravālānām lohānām tāntavasya ca
translated: If a Vaishya desires, they should never be protected by anyone else.🔽Of gems, pearls, corals, metals, and cloth,

original: gandhānāṃ ca rasānāṃ ca vidyād arghabalābalam // / //
analyzed: gandhānām ca rasānām ca vidyāt argha balābalam
translated: And of perfumes and flavors, one should know the value and worthlessness.

original: bījānām uptivic ca syāt kṣetradoṣaguṇasya ca /
analyzed: bījānām uptivid ca syāt kṣetra doṣa guṇasya ca
translated: One should know the sowing of seeds and the faults and virtues of the field,

original: mānayogaṃ ca jānīyāt tulāyogāṃś ca sarvaśaḥ // / //🔽sārāsāraṃ ca bhāṇḍānāṃ deśānāṃ ca guṇāguṇān /
